father concerning pronoune hoc teſtimony epiphanius advantageth romiſh cauſe sect vii compare epiphanius owne epiphanius ancorato videmus quod accepit salvator manus veluti evangeliſta habet quod ſurrexit à coena accepit haec cum gratias egiſſet dixit hoc meum eſt hoc videmus quod non aequale eſt ne que ſimile non imagini carne non inviſibili deitati non lineamentis membrorum hoc enim rotundae formae eſt inſenſibile quantum ad potentiam voluit per gratiam dicere hoc meum eſt hoc nemo non fidem habet ſermoni qui enim non credit ipſum eſſe verum excidit à gratia ſalute ob bellar lib 2 de euch cap 20 word cardinalls cum docere vellet epiphan hominem verè factum ad imaginem dei licet non facile app • reat quo conſiſtat ſimilitudo inter deum et hominem cum deus incorporalis ſit immenſus et dicit multa eſſe ejuſmodi quae aliud ſunt aliud videntur ponit exemplum de euchariſtia quae verè eſt corpus chriſti tamen nihil minus eſt quam quod appareat exterius cum ſit • otundum et inſenſibile proinde validè diſſimile corpori chriſti hic ſanè locus omninò convinci • nam quod dicit oporet credere ipſum eſſe verum excludit tropos praeſertim cum addat excidere à salute qui non credit quod etiam addit ciedendum eſſe licet ſenſus repugnent apertiſſime teſtatur non cum loqui de ſignificatione ſed de ipſa word obſerved greeke theſe 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 laſt word ſhew inſenſible taken reſolveth thatc men image god yet according nature namely ſubſtantiall nature god becauſe god incomprehenſible infinite c maine point epiphanius illuſtrate ſomething ſaith cardinall ſeemeth epiphanius inſtanceth eucharist wherein chriſt taking hand thoſe thing evangeliſts mention ſaid one hoc mine viz body mine viz blood hereby underſtanding ſaith objector euchariſt truely body chriſt although ſeeme ſo outwardly round figure inſenſible without ſenſe therefore farre unlike body chriſt thinking hath overcome doth raiſe iö triumph ſaying argument throughly convincent becauſe epiphanius addeth believeth word chriſt doth fall salvation adding beleeved although ſenſes gaineſay heard objection ſeeming ſo great champion ſo greatly convincent give u licence make full anſwer firſt hoc et hoc interpretation epiphanius meant thing evangeliſt mention evangeliſt mentioned know bread tooke bread tooke cup meaning wine cup namely according thesee chap 1 § 6 former generall conſent father hoc ſignifyed bread one part euchariſt wine bread neither subſtance accident called chriſts body without trope hath beenesee chap 1 § 4 confeſſed firſt confutation cardinal concludeth epiphanius excludeth trope chriſts speech hoc secondly epiphanius ancorato habent omnes id quod eſt ſecundùm imaginem dei ſed non ſecundùm naturam non enim ſecundùm aequalitatem habent homines deus enim mente incō prehenſibilis eſt cum ſpiritus ſit ſuper omnem ſpiritū men ſaith epiphanius image god although according nature equality becauſe god spirit spirit incomprehenſible ſeeketh similitude euchariſt image thing ſeemeth nature equality euchariſt two thing diſtinguiſhed one naturall sacramentall thereof naturall element bread wine cannot make similitude becauſe whether taken subſtances accident hoc hath proportion word called meum meaning chriſts body becauſe hoc epiphanins ſaith round figure hoc hoc sacramentall image repreſenting meum meum chriſts body blood bread broken betoken body crucifyed wine poured apart ſignifie chriſts blood shed ſo similitude moſt harmonicall even bread wine euchariſt although differ nature yet repreſentative signes image body blood chriſt image god man hath reſemblance godhead although reſpect nature equality different finite infinite comprehenſible incomprehenſible according analogicall myſticall acramentall ſenſe upon hearing theſe word epiphanius whoſoever believe chriſts word hee ſaid falleth grace wee willingly ſhall ſay amen rather becauſe epiphanius adverſarie marcionites denyed chriſt true body onely phantaſticall notwithſtanding panis corpus chriſti quid efficiunturij qui participant corpus ſanè chriſti quia ait apoſtolus unus panis unum corpus ſumus quia de uno pane participamus ex multis namque granis ut exempli gratia loquamur unus panis factus eſt no multi ex uno pane participantes efficimur unum corpus chriſti one bread body christ made partake one bread body chriſt one bread made many granes many partaker one bread made one body hence doctor judgement needeth explanation asking queſtion bread anſwereth body chriſt note reader ſaith signe christ body body chriſt verily ſpeaketh bread partaken ſaith verily chriſts body alſo partaker made myſticall body chriſt wherein reader may ſee rightly confirmeth catholike faith ſo wee thinke doth muſt popiſh catholike faith becauſe oecumenmus calleth ſo bread body christ sacramentally hee calleth partaker ſame bread loafe myſticall body christ partaker communicant chriſts myſticall body figuratively analogy therfore bread named naturall body chriſt figuratively symboll thereof chriſt himſelfe calleth iudgement antiquitie throughout second booke therfore apoſtle calleth bread conſecration oecumenius noteth ſuch bread conſiſteth many granes corne muſt need cap 13 § gregor nyſſen explicat ambroſius lib 4 de sacrament cap 4 quae ſint verba domini quibus sacramentum conficitur recitans illa hoc eſt c et lib de init myſter cap 9 ipſe clamat dominus ieſus hoc eſt corpus meum ante benedictionem verborum coeleſtium alia ſpecies nominatur poſt conſecraticnem corpus chriſti eſt body chriſt ſignified iuſt proteſtantwiſe tell u wiſh wee ſhould cenſure errour whether wilfull falſity ſhould eclipſe credit authority elſe temeritie ought cenſure indifferently ſuch eſcapes ſuch happen proteſtants according law equitie—veniam petimuſque damuſque viciſsim saint auguſtine one profeſſion hath late choicely ſingled patron romiſh defence hath unanſwerably impugned romiſh faith point proving sacrament agree like predication herein euchariſt hath prerogative reſt aug lib 3 de doctr chriſt figurata locutio idem cont adimant manich cap 12 non dubitavit dicere hoc eſt corpus meum cum ſignū daret corporis ſui idem epiſt 23 ad bonifac tom 9 sacramenta propter ſimilitudinem earum rerum quas repraeſentant plerun que etiam ipſarum rerum nomina accipiunt sicut ergò ſecundùm quendam modum sacramentum corporis chriſti corpus chriſti et sacramentum ſanguinis chriſti ſanguis chriſti ità sacramentum fidei ſides eſt—sicut de ipſo baptiſmo ait conſepulti ſumus per baptiſmum mortem chriſti non dicit ſepulturam ſignificamus ſed prorſus ait conſepulti ſumus—sacramentum igitur tantae rei non niſi ejusdam rei vocabulo nuncupavit intripreting called fidei sacramentum hee ſa 〈◊〉 reſpondetur parvulum baptizatum credere propter fidei sacramentum sacrament ſaith similitude likeneſſe wihich thing wherof sacrament often take name thoſe thing ſignific sacrament chriſts body ſaith certaine manner called body chriſt hee addeth hee meant ſtop mouthes oppoſites ſaid apoſtle baptiſme buried baptiſme death chriſt ſaith ſignifie buriall abſolutely ſaith buried therfore hath called sacrament signe ſo great thing name thing ſignified thereby hee even ſame hee bee found like himſelfe following paſſages book eſpecially wee ſhall handle manner eating chriſts body auguſtine challenge bee figuratively meant ⚜ anſwerers ſo puzzled saint auguſtine teſtimonies may doubt whether rather pity perplexity elſe hate perverſeneſſe may ſee another teſtimony ſame father wee may let paſſe aug con adimant cap 12 scriptum eſt ſanguinem precoris animam ejus eſſe—poſſum interpretari praeceptum illud ſigno eſſe poſitum non enim dubitavit chriſtus dicere hoc eſt corpus meum cum ſignum dedit corporis ſui chriſt doubted ſay body hee gave signe body even hee ſaith hee might interpret scripture deut 12 blood beaſt life beaſt blood ſigne thereof ſole ayme expound verbe eſt bee signe signifieth whether bell l 2 de euch cap 24 two laſt beſt anſweres aug intelligere non nudum ſignum ſed cum ipſa conjunctum nec corporis abſentis ut ſanguis ſignum non animae abſentis 2 sol signum corporis immolari cruce cardinall fancieth signe chriſts body preſent euchariſt rather abſent croſſe aug regardeth mention meerly teach doth exactly elſewhere whereſoever thing predicated affirmed another thing different nature signe called name thing ſignified ſpeech figurative chriſt apoſtle called rocke auguſt quaeſt ſuper levit cap 57 non eſt dictum petra ſignificat chriſtum ſed petra erat chriſtus ſic ſolet loqui scriptura re ſignificātes tanquàm re quae ſignificantur appellans tract 77 ſaid ſaith saint auguſtine rocke ſignifieth chriſt rocke chriſt uſuall ſaith scripture calleth ſignes thing name thing themſelves ſignified thereby impertinent adjoyne hereunto ieſuiticall interpretation theſe word apoſtle rocke chriſt compare saint auguſtine thereby may better diſcerne light darkeneſſe ia • gordon ieſ lib controv 3 cap 7 num 21 petra erat chriſtus 1 cor 10 germanus literalis ſenſus non eſt iſte petra ſignificat chriſtum ut putant adverſarij qui ex hoc loco contendunt probare verbum ſub ſtantiv • n eſt aliquandò uſurpari pro ſignificat ut indè faciliùs ign • ri perſuadeant verbum eſt verbis chriſti idem valere quod ſignificat literall proper senſe theſe word ſaith hee adverſaries meaning proteſtants doe hold rocke ſignified chriſt contending hereupon prove verbe est ſometime uſed signifieth thereby may eaſily perſwade word est chriſts speech ſame senſe signifieth hee heretike could confronted saint auguſtine ieſuite hath denying word rocke chriſt bee true senſe signifie chriſt secondly eſt elſewhere uſed scripture significat saint augustine abſolute adverſarie yet theſe indeed whole cauſe concerning corporall preſence chriſt sacrament cauſe saint auguſtines interpretation plaine adimantus manichee objected iewe aug cont adimant quo ſap adimantus manichaeus • ſecundùm intellectum iudaeorum qui dicunt ſanguinem eſſe animam ſequi c underſtood text blood beaſt ſoule thereof conteined ſoule joyned ſoule ſoule ſelfe literall interpretation auguſtine declineth expoundeth word ſpoken figuratively signe thing ſignified proſperi de conſecrat diſt •• cap—hoc eſt quod dicimus ſicut ergò coeleſtis panis qui chriſti caro eſt ſuo modo vocatur corpus chriſti cum reverâ ſit sacramē u n corporis chriſti illius videlicet quod viſibile quod palpabile 〈◊〉 mortale cruze poſitum eſt vocatur que ipſa immolatio carnis quae sacerdotis manibus ſit chriſti paſſio mors crucifixio non rei veritate ſed ſignificante myſterio heavenly bread ſaith hee chriſts fleſh called maner body chriſt indeed sacrament chriſts body wit body viſible palpable mortall immolation fleſh done hand prieſt called chriſts paſsion death crucifixion veritie thing significant myſterie word ſhould need comment better owne publike privileged romiſh gloſſe upon ſaying gl • ſſa eum locum coeleſtis id eſt coeleſte sacramentum quod verè repraeſentat chriſti carnem dicitur corpus chriſti ſed impropriè unde dicitue ſuo modo non rel veritate ſed ſigniſicante myſterio ut ſit ſenſus vocatur corpus chriſti id eſt significat heavenly sacrament truly repreſenteth chriſts fleſh called body chriſt improperly ſaid certaine maner bodie chriſt foure principall obſervables one ſentence saint auguſtine doctor vilified sacrament becauſe wee judging bread onely account sacrament chriſts body saint auguſtine doth reprove directly hee ſaid though sacrament chriſts body yet eſteemed heavenly bread ii often reade bread called chriſts body inſufficiencie anſwers may juſtly ſeeme good prevaricating cauſe objected miniſter cannot pronounce theſe word chriſt body ſame proprietie speech wherein chriſt himſelfe ſpake therefore cannot bee conſecrative word according romane faith uttered miniſter hee muſt deliver either narratively way repetition read goſpell romane miſſall ſaying ieſus tooke bread hee given thankes brake gave diſciples ſaying body ſo miniſter rehearſing chriſts word ſhould conſecrate bread wherof chriſt ſpake ſaying inſtitution sacrament bread miniſters hand made viſible people elſe ſhould pronounce ſame word according owne terme significatively ſo ſpeaking perſon chriſt chriſt himſelfe ſhould pronounce ſo prieſts ſaying body word ſhould ſignifie body prieſt body chriſt ſhrewd objection ſo puzleth doctor see bellarm lib 4 de euchariſt cap 14 § objicitur—poſſunt verba duobus modis dici aut narrativè ac recitativè vel significativè ut exempli gratia cùm ex evangelio recitamus dixiſſe iudaeos de chriſto hic blaſphemat illa verba hic blaſphemat à rudaeis dicebantur ſignificativè id enim volebant chriſtum eſſe blaſphemum à nobis autem non dicuntur significativè ſed tantum narrativè non enim ſignificare volumus chriſtum eſſè blaſphemum ſed iudaeos hoc dixiſ • e hac diſtinctione poſitâ eſt hoc argu nentum verba illa hoc eſt corpus mean vel dicuntur à sacerdotibus recitativè vel significativè ſed neutro modo poſſunt eſſe forma sacramenti igitur non ſunt • ſta verba forma sacramenti probatur aſſumptio nam ſi iſta verba dicerentur recitativè primò ſequeretur per illùd hoc demonſtrari panem qui ſuit manibus chriſti non iſtum qui eſt man • bus sacerdotis ac proinde non conſecraretur panis qui conſecrandus proponitur altari secundò ſequeretur non poſſe conſecrari quidquam verbis nam verba conſecrant dum faciunt quod ſignificant iſta autem nihil ſignificant dum dicuntur materi liter tantùm non significativè si autem dicerentu • significativè primò illud hoc eſt corpus meum demonſtraret corpus sacerdotis non chriſti ac dicere oportet hoc eſt corpus chriſti—reſpondeo verba illa dici utroque modo recitativè significativè cujus rei gratia notanda ſunt tria primum sacerdos quando confitetur peccata ſua quando orat quando laudat chriſtum agit ſine dubio perſonam ſuam non chriſti quando dicit hoc eſt corpus meum agit perſonam chriſti—secundum hac actione longè aliter sacerdotem agere perſonam chriſti quàm alijs sacramentes nam alijs agit ut chriſti miniſter tamen loquitur perſonâ ſuâ ut cùm dicit ego te baptizo ego te abſolvo—at conſecratione euchariſtiae sacerdos non ſolùm agit ut chriſti miniſter ſed induit omnino chriſti perſonam ac loquitur ac ſi ipſe eſſet chriſtus quomodò exod 3 angelus dicit ego ſum deus patris tui tertium—sacerdotem actione liturgiae uſque ad illa verba qui pridiè quàm pateretur agere perſonam ſuam non chriſti ut paret quia couſque orat vel laudat ab illis autem verbis uſque ad finem conſecrationis agere perſonam ſuam chriſti ideò recitativè ſimul significativè verba pronunc • intendit enim recitare qu • chriſtus egerit dixerit ſimul omnia imitari perſona chriſti ac ſi chriſtus per ipſius myſterium iterum omnia faceret diceret vaſquez 3 thom quaeſt 78 artic 4 diſput 200 cap 1 nonnulli exiſtimant • verba recitativè ſumi innocent 3 durand major catharinus ledeſma gabriel ratio quia ſi significativè tantùm eſſent falſa nihil ſignificantia aliud ore sacerdotis quàm ore chriſti viz chriſtum ſolu • dixiſſe apoſtolis sumite bibite c ad haec quod ſi significativè tum miniſter non oſtenderet corpus chriſti ſed ſuum diceus meum quod eſſet falſum—alij verò conſent verba formae conſecrationis proferri à sacerdote non ſolùm significativè perſona chriſti ſicut qui comoedia induit perſonam regis aut alterius aſſumens ejus verba ea profert significativè perſona illius ſed etiam recitativè quamvis non materialiter cap 2 mihi ſanè prima opinio ſummopere diſplicuit eo quod ſemper judicaverim nullâ ratione negari poſſe verba conſecrationis significativè à sacerdote uſurpari cùmque duo illi modi nempe recitativè significativè inter ſe pugnent ut eandem vocem aut orationem convenire nequeant—eſt igitur ſententia quidem judice probabilior verba conſecrationis quae ſunt proforma significativè ſolùm à sacerdote proferri non autem recitativè hoc eſt narrativè tamedi perſona chriſti ab eo efferantur—atque huc ſpectat quod concilium trident câdem seſſ 13 cap 3 inquit ſub ſpeciebùs panis ſolum eſſe corpus ex vi verborum na •• per vim verborum ſignificationem eorum denotat et ita ſolum ſignificent corpus ſolum illud ſub ſpecie panis vi ſuâ conſt ••• unt adde haec duo inter ſe pugnant nam recitativè idem eſt quod referre alium illud dixiſſe eo aliquid ſignificâſſe qui refert verba alterius mendacium recitando dictum ejus mentiretur ſed falſum dixit non mend • c • um deinde ſi recitativè tum verba non pertinerent ad materiam praeſentem et cap 3—verba praecedentia ſolùm dicuntur recitativè ut attentum faciant sacerdotem ipſum verba conſecranonis non ex proprio ſenſu ſed perſona ſenſi chriſti ac ſi ille praeſens eſſer cùm reverà illius vicem ſerat proximè pronuntiet veluti ſi quis volens repraeſentare perſonam regis hiſtoricè referat aliqua facta ipſius ut ſtatim nomine ejus significat vè incipiat loqui participium autem dicens quod refertur etiam ad verba conſecrationis non eſſicit ut illa recitativè dicantur ſed nomine illius qui ea tunc dixit pronuntientur atque de hoc tantum per illud participium dicens admonemur marginalls beſtirre themſelves like souldiers would doe withſtanding batterie defending breach one company ſay prieſt uttereth chriſts word onely narratively rehearſing ſecond ranke anſwers recitingly significatively ſo ſaith third troope becauſe ſpake ſo miniſter word angell ſignifieth meſſenger god perſon god ieſuite suarez mend ſhew man may ſame word ſpeake owne perſon perſon another suarez 3 thom diſp 58 § 4 non tantùm recitativè ſed etiam formaliter significativè proferuntur ſignificando—quià ut verba efficiant conſecrationem praeſentis materiae oportet ut illa verba ſignificent alioqui non efficiunt ut ait thomas ulterius dici poſſit ſi ſolùm materialiter proferentur ex veritate illorum non poſſet colligi hoc quod nunc eſt manibus sacerdotis eſſe verum corpus chriſti quià illa hoc non ſignificant—non poteſt colligi ex hoc quòd chriſtus ea form litèr protulit nec ex facto chriſti—cum dicit conc tridentinum ex veritate verborum chriſti colligi ejus praeſentiam non loquitur tantùm de verbis ut à chriſto prolata ſunt ſed ut à sacerdote proferuntur chriſtus ait chryſoſt per o sacerdotis loquitur et ambroſius non 〈◊〉 utitur sacerdos verbis ſuis ſed chriſti—et aliquanto poſt praecedentia ſubſequentia tantùm materialiter proferuntur illa verba etiam significativè propter myſterium poſſit enim quis loqui vel perſona ſua vel aliena—ut ſi regium concilium sententiam proferat vel ſimilibus verbis nobis injunctum eſt ut poſſint hominem non proter •• tranſubſtantitionem admittere bell lib 3 de euch c 23 § secundò trent tranſubſtantiation collected ſole true proper signification theſe word body challenge wherein ſhew ſelves bee men great faith rather credulity little conſcience teaching bee undoubtedly true whereof notwithſtanding ſelves render many cauſes doubting firſt scotus quem cameracenſis ſequtur—dicunt non extare locū scripturis tàm expreſſum ut fine declaratione eccleſiae evidentes cogat tranſubſtantiationem admittere atque hoc non eſt omninò improbabile quià ità ſit dubitari poteſt cum homines acutiſſimi doctiſſimi qualis inprimis scotus fuit contrarium ſentiant bellar quo ſupra cajetanus aliqui vetuſtiores audiendi non ſunt qui dicunt panem definere eſſe non tàm ex evangelio quàm ex eccleſiae authoritate conſtare alan lib 1 de euch c 34 pag 419 grant beſides cardinall caejetane ſome ancient schoolemen scotus cameracenſis men learned acute held one place scripture ſo expreſſe without declaration church evidently compell man admit tranſubſtantiation cardinall greateſt adverſary faithsee former allegation b altogether improbable whereunto biſhopcorpus chriſti fieri per conſecrationem non probatur nudis evangelij verbis ſine pia interpretatione eccleſiae roffenſ epiſc con capt bab cap 9 pag 99 roffenſis giveth conſent secondly alſo confeſſed ſome doctor church becauſe could find ſo full evidence proofe tranſubſtantiation word chriſt driven ſo hard ſhifts tohoc eſt pro tranſit bonaventura decet idem ferè habet oceam hol cott inſinuat etiam waldenſis—volunt propoſitionem illam non eſſe ſubſtantivè ſed tranſitive interpretandam ſc ut ſit ſenſus hoc eſt corpus id eſt tranſit corpus—sed hoc corrumpit ſignificationē verbi eſt quod ſi permittitur nulla eſt vi hujus modi verbis ad probandam realem praeſentiam nec ſubſtantiam panis hic non manere et ità potuit haereticus exponere hoc eſt id eſt repraeſentat corpus suarez ieſ tom 3 qu 78 diſp 58 sect 7 art 1 pag 754 change verbe subſtantive eſt verbe paſsive tranſitive fit tranſit ſtead ſay made paſſeth body chriſt senſe ieſuite suarez cannot allow becauſe hee truly ſaith corrupting text albeit indeed word tranſubſtantiation importeth fieri ſeu tranſire making paſsing one subſtance another ſtill ſee tranſubſtantiation cannot bee extracted text without violence word chriſt ⚜the like violence uſed ieſuit iac gordon scotus ieſ lib controv 4 cap 3 n 15 propoſitiones practicae proferuntur per verba praeſentis temporis non futuri ut certi 〈◊〉 de effectuve borum haec verba hoc eſt corpus meum practica ſunt efficiunt quod ſignificant mandu ••• ex hoc bibite ex hoc ubique demonſtrat corpus chriſti futurum vel ſanguinem ejus futorum similis ſtatuitur verbis conſecrationis alioqui iſta production becauſe ſameproductio eſt quando terminus ad quem non exiſtat ideò vi converſionis neceſſariò producitur ut aqua vinum adductiva autem c bellar lib 3 de euchariſt cap 18 § secundò notandum—productiva non eſt quia corpas domini praeexiſtit idem ibid § ex cardinall truly argueth converſion production thing produced yet extant chriſt converted water wine wine extant produced ſubſtance water body chriſt alwaies extant therefore ſaid produced ſubſtance bread productive maner tranſubſtantiation could believed ieſuitesde ratione tranſubſtantiationis non eſt ut subſtantia quam dicitur fieri tranſubſtantirio producatur aut conſervetur per illam imo qui hoc modo defendunt tranſubſtantiationem sacramento ad quoddam genus philoſophiae excogitatum potius quàm ad verum verſionis adducetur ad eum locum inde vocatur converſio adductiva nam corpus chriſti praeexiſtit 〈◊〉 converſionem ſed non ſub ſpeciebus panis con verſio igitur non fecit ut corpus chriſti ſimpliciter eſſe incipiat ſed ut incipiat eſſe ſub ſpeciebus non quod per motum localem è coelo adducatur ſed ſolùm quia per hanc converſionem fit ut quod ante erat ſolùm coelo jam ſit ſub ſpeciabus panis nec haec accidentalis converſio ſed ſubſtantialis dictum eſt quia ſubſtantia panis deſinit eſſe ſubſtantia corporis chriſti ſuccedit pani proindè subſtantia subſtantiam tranſit talis eſt converſio cibi hominem per nutritionem nam anima non producitur ſed tantùm per nutritionem ſit ut incipiat eſſe ea materia ubi antea erat forma cibi bellar lib 3 de euch cap 18 cardinall defineth bringing subſtance confutable even owne principle hold bread bee tranſubſtantiated changed chriſts body bee annihilated brought meere nothing cannot bee ſaid bee tranſubſtantiated whether thinke bread conſecration annihilated deſire know ſelves say ſpeak without liſping ſtammering pray may heare underſtand bellar lib 3 de euch cap 24 nego panem annihilari—nam etſi panis nihil ſit tamen id quod ipſe converſus ēſt non eſt nihil nec nullū nec nuſquam although bread conſecration bee nothing ſaith bellarmine yet annihilated brought nothing leſsius ieſ opuſc lib 12 cap 16 circa ſubſtantiam panis vini primū miraculum eſt quòd hae ſubſtantiae vi cō ſecrationis funditus pereant veluti annihilentur quamvis non ſolemus dicere ea annthilari eò quod haec deſitio ex intentione divinâ non ſiſtat nihilo ſed dirigatur ad poſitionem corporis chriſti verum hoc ad modum loquendi ſpectat nam quod ad rem attinet nihil omninò ſubſtantiae panis manet non forma non materia non exiſtentia non gradus aliquis ſed totum ità funditùs perit acſi prorſus nihilum redactum eſſet nullo poſitivo ſuccedēte nam quod aliud ſuccedat non eſt ex vi illius deſitio nis—ſubſtantifico influxu ſubtracto neceſſe eſt rem nihilum relabi ſubſtance bread wine ſaith ieſuit leſsius doe utterly periſh annihilated calling nothing yet annihilated annihilated yet utterly periſhing naming alſo maner bee miraculous hold worthy rather eſteemed monſtrous ſpeech altogether ſo contradictory ſelfe wherefore wee deſire foreſaid ieſuite play oedipus unfolding riddle ſaying ſaith hee bread wine annihilated belongeth formalitie ſpeech concerning thing ſelfe nothing bread remaining either forme matter ſay nothing either forme matter ſurely annihilated therfore bread becomming nothing chriſts body preſent cannot poſſibly bee ſaid bee changed chriſts body abſent rather becauſe one ioh pallanterius de caſtro ſacrae theologiae doctor lectiones aureae nec materia nec forma panis manent ſe vel corpore chriſti poſt converſionem quià vere annihilantur doctor ingenuouſly confeſſeth bread remaining either matter forme truly annihilated argument apprehenſion inſoluble wee receive great dictator better anſwer bellar quo ſuprà pani ſucredit corpus chriſti corrumpitur interit quicquid definit eſſe non annihilatur niſi ità deſinat eſſe ut nihil ea ſuccedit ità ut ejus deſitio terminetur nihil becauſe ſubſtance bread ceaſeth bee ſubſtance chriſts body ſucceedeth therefore ſubſtance bread ſaid changed chriſts body crotchet change succeeding hath already exploded tranſlocation owne see g societie yet againe may bee plainly ieſuit vaſquez vaſquez 3 thom qu 75 art 8 diſp 181 cap 2 panis conveerſione deſinit eſſe cùm dicitur panem deſinere corpus chriſti non probat ipſam deſitionem terminari formaliter ad poſitivum quod fit converſio—quocirca modus ille loquendi non formaliter ſed cauſ liter debet intelligi quis enim dicat defitionem alicujus rei formaliter aliquid termanari—ità ut ipſa productio ſeu adductio non ſit formaliter converſio ſed cauſa illius—eſt igitur converſio formaliter denominatio quaedam ordinis per modum actus eo quod definit relatum ad id quod fuit cauſa deſition • aliquam 〈…〉 haea duo quae diximus ſunt neceſſaria ſufficiunt ut panis vinum hoc ipſo quod deſinant dicantur converti corpus eſt ſanguinem chriſti neither production adduction formally converſion second proofe falſhood article tranſubſtantiation article chriſtian creed borne virgin mary sect ii tranſubſtantiation hath beene defined councell trent converſion ſubſtance bread subſtance chriſts body every ſuch subſtantiall production subſtance chriſts body subſtance bread cardinall hath evaſion denying converſion production notwithſtanding formerly generall tenet romiſh schoole ever ſince doctrine tranſubſtantiation hatched contrary owne device converſion adduction wherein firſt dictum corpus chriſti ex pane fieri non tanquàm ex materia ſed tanquàm à termino à quo ut mundus ex nihilo confuting himſelfe etiam ſit ex aqua vinum ex nihilo praeſenti negotio converſio non eſt productiva panis enim convertitur corpus chriſti praeexiſtens ergò corpus chriſti factum ex pane ex carne eſt idem bell l 3 de euc c 24 § ad ſuum dixit undè apparet sanguinem chriſti non offerti 〈◊〉 deſit vinum calici cyprian ad cecil epiſt 63 paulò ante medium epiphan cont encratit qui aquam ſolùm adhibuerunt euchariſtia • ut dicant vino quoque utendum hoc ſermene domini inquit redarguuntur non bibam de fructu hujus vitis epiphan tom 2 lib 2 non bibam de genimine hujus vitis chriſtus poſt reſurrectionem nè putaretur phantaſia comedit undè apoſtoli dixerunt act 10 comedimus bibimus cum eo sed cujus gratiâ non aquam ſed vinum bibit ad pernicioſam haereſin radicitus evellendam eorum qui aquâ myſterijs utuntur idem nuda myſterij menſa vino uſus eſt ex genimine vitis certè vinum non aquam producit chryſoſt eum locum hom 83 marginals doe manifeſt ſo plainly affirme wine christ dranke hereby practice heretikes aquarij confuted would drinke nothing water euchariſt commeth fruit vine certainly produceth wine water chryſoſt wine ſaith auguſt de dogmat eccleſ cap 75 vinum fuit redemptionis noſtrae myſterijs cùm dixit non bibam ſtrait staffe bee crooked ſtandeth water thinking white object bee greene ſelfe ſeene thorow greene glaſſe secondly unequall diſtance place concelving sunne bee two feete breadth thirdly ſome defect organ inſtrument ſeeing eye whereby cometh paſſe wee take one bee two miſtake shadow subſtance yet notwithſtanding eye ſee good conſtitution temper medium whereby wee ſee perfectly diſpoſed diſtance object wee ſee indifferent ſay judgement senſe free true concurrence joynt conſent diver senſes one arbitrement infallible reaſon taken senſe peradventure judge bee naturall carnall thoſe termes oppoſed true chriſtian maner reaſoning defend contrary warranted argument chriſt himſelfe uſed diſciples luke 24 39 handle mee ſee cardinall although hee grant reaſon chriſt available prove owne body spirit fancy true body even onely argument ſenſe touching conſequentia chriſti affirmativè ſumpta hoc palpatur hoc videtur ergo eſt corpus optu • fuit quià ſenſus non fallitur circa proprium objectum • ta que neceſſariò quod videtur tangitur corporale eſt negativè hoc non palpatur nec videtur ergò non eſt corpus dominus non fecit mala eſt non falluntur senſus noſtri cum no album quid rotundum ſolidum ſentire arbitramur quae ſunt propria objècta sed cùm panis subſtantiam ſub illis accidentibus • atere denunciant falluntur dominus ſolùm probare voluit ſe non eſſe inane ſpectrum ſeu phantaſma ſed verum corpus id quod ex teſtimonio ſenſus tangendi optimè probavit illud autem corpus eſſe humanum idem quod anteà ſuerat non probavit dominus hoc ſolo argumento ex tangendi ſenſu deſumpto quod ſine dubio non erat ſufficiens ſed multis alijs modis loquendo manducando teſtimonio angelorum miraculo piſcium allegatione scripturarum bellar l 1 de euch c 14 § reſpondeo yet ſaith hee ſufficient ſelfe without argument confirme prove bin human body ſame anſwer cardinall wee wiſh onely falſe alſo greatly irreligious chriſt demonſtrated hereby onely hee body cardinall ſpeaketh alſo owne ſame humane body riſen beene crucified wounded death buried according luke even luke 24 39 becauſe1 cor 15 reſurrection body except bee body therefore would chriſt thomas ioh 20 27 thruſt hand ſides feele viii pererius ieſuit confidently pleadeth senſe touch illud ſine dubitatione dicere non verebor non polle ab ullo • mone formari corpus corpus adeò ſimile humano ut ſiquis cum curà animi attentione id tangeret non facilè dignoſceret ipſum non eſſe corpus humanum itaque non poterit daemon ſimilitudine corporis humani oculos fallere tactus autem ſenſum fallere omninò non poteſt quod quatuor argumentis confirmabo—hoc veriſſimum eſſe patet ex eo quod chriſtus dixit diſcipulis ſuis palpate videte thomae digitum c perer ieſ gen 6 num 78 pag 2 feare ſaith hee ſay evidence senſe ſo ſtrong potuiſſent chriſti vera oſta carnes diſcernere mollitiem duritiem eorum non dixiſſet ijs palpate videte ac ſi diceret palpate percipite veras carnes oſſa vaſquez ieſ tom 2 qu 51 art 2 diſp 184 cap 2 pag 487 thomas dicit ſingula argumenta non fuiſſe per ſe ſufficientia benè tamen conjuncta probari cum teſtimonijs prophetarum—ego tamen cùm cajetano argumentum illud tactus efficaciſſimum fuiſſe ad comprobandum vetitatem corporis humani chriſto idem ibid vaſquez much ſayd perceive true fleſh moſt efficacious argument proove truth humane body hee yea illud thomae non credam c pertinaciae obdurationis vitium erat peccatum infidelitatis optimè orig lib 2 con celſum ubi docet diſcipulos affirmâſſe illum quem viderunt eſſe chriſtum corpore vero ſuo reſuſcitato nam thomas ſciebat anima interdùm apparere corporibus proprias formare vox tamen non eſſe corpus vera quapropter non dixit ſolùm niſi videro non credam ſed adjunxit niſi infero manum veſtigia clavorum tolet ieſ com ioh 20 tolet another ieſuite well diſcerne caſe thomas beene extreme infidelity hee ſaid except put finger print nayles thruſt hand ſide beleeve prooveth efficaciouſneſſe iudgement senſe reducing ſo extreme vnbeleever beleeve wherein author authorized auguſtine aug de tempore si fortè inquit diceremus thomae oculos fuiſſe deceptos non poſſemus dicere • u fruſtratas de tactu non poteſt dubitari et greg pont plus nobis thomae infidelitas ad fidem quàm fides credentium diſcipulorum proſuit quià dubius ille carnem palpando ad fidem reducitur men noſtra omni dubltatione poſtpoſitâ teſte maldon ieſ com florentinis à siciliae rege ſubornato illicò caepit aegret • ferebatur monachus ſub unguibus venenum habuiſſe quo calicem hoſtiam infecerat mox obi • imperator beneventi animain deo reddidit anno 1313 cuſpinian volater lib 23 ut reſert zuingerus iv quod vermis generantur ex sacramento dubium non eſt cùm experimentis conſtet difficultas ergo circa modum eſt suarez ieſ tom 3 qu 77 art 5 diſp 57 pag 427 alij ex aëre vermis generari dicunt thomas refert hanc opinionem ſed dicit eam eſſe contrariam ei quod ad ſenſum apparet quod reverà ita eſt ſatiſ que ab ipſo quatuor rationibus confirmatur suarez ibid v generatio nutritio fit ex quantitate panis quae divinitùs locum tenet materiae panis ut thomas explicat greg de valent ieſ lib 2 exam • tag calvin p 446 nullam eſſe neceſſariam materiam ſed ſolam quantitatem ſufficere ut ſubſtet formae ſubſtantiali advenienti ſive de potentia ejus educatur ſive per nutritionem varietur sic thomas alij fundamentum hujus opinionis eſt quià convenienter hic modus eſt ſine novi • miraculis haec opinio videtur falſa mihi omninò incredibilis—dicendum eſt neceſſariam eſſe omninò aliquam materiam ex qua generatio ſiat quià de ratione eſſentiali hujus compoſiti eſt ſubſtantialis materia propter quod ariſtoteles dicit impoſſibile eſſe subſtantiam componi à non ſubſtantiâ ergo impoſſibile eſt ut quantitas aleretur ad proprium munus materiae ſubſtantialem cauſalitatem ejus suarez quo ſupra diſp 57 art 8 § 3 p 733 algerus guitmundus waldenſis dicunt ex ſpeciebus nutritionem generationem fieri non poſſe suarez ibid vtrùm materia generationis ſit eadem quae fuit antèa ſub ſpeciebus panis vel alia thomas eandem eſſe negat ne multiplicetur miraculum ſinè neceſſitate vi mihi tamen videtur eandem numero eſſe—etiam juxtâ quorundam veterum sententiam alenſ bonavent innocent nec majus eſt miraculum ſive eandem ſivè materiam novam facere suarez ibid ſelves diſcerned ſometimes sacrament theſe firſt cup doth inebriate make drunke secondly hoaſt taken great quantity doth nouriſh thirdly poyſoned payſoneth fourthly beene long reſerved engendereth wormes bred alſo fed ſame fiftly matter generation nouriſhment subſtantiall contrary opinion falſe incredible sixtly matter whereof wormes bred fed ſame bread taken conſecration owne prime schoolemen hiſtorians ieſuites reſpectively bread ingendring wormes taken conſecrated ſay conſecrated ſtill ſame senſes giving teſtimony thereunto first challenge nothing anſwer bread wherof new wormes bred whether bee yet bread wrought either aquomodò fiat haec materia—thomiſtae hot ſweet conſecration none deny muſt either quality quantity materiall subſtance wee conſulting two owne ieſuites heare one maintaining theſe two accident bellarm lib 3 de euchariſt cap 24 § reſpondeo tractantur—si mutatio pane euchariſtiae ſit ſola alteratio ut calefactio cōdenſatio tum non requiritur materia aut ſubſtantia pro ſubjecto nam accidētia omnia pro ſubjecto habent quantitatem quae sacramento maneat unde hoſtia conſecrata dicitur alba ſapida rotunda parva haec enim omnia denominant quantitatem alioqui non poſſit fieri denominatio non enim accidentia de ſeipſis dicunſu • concreto ſed ſolùm de subjecto exceptà quan •• tate quae dicitur quantitas quantum quantity subject leſsius ieſ opuſc de perfectionibus divinis lib 12 cap 16 num 112 alterum miraculum eſt circa ſpecies quòd ita paſſiones impreſſiones ſuſcipiant aliarum quantitatum perindè ac ſi materiae panis vini rema •• rent caleſcunt enim specie atque frigeſeunt ſimileſque mutationes ſubeunt quidam putant quantitatem ſol •• eſſe immediate subject •• h omnium accidentinum quod difficile eſt creditu quid enim quantitatis indoli cum illis qualitatibus non enim quantitas haber ullam propenſionem ad ſubſtantia vel natura panis via • certè imago ſimilitudo corporis ſanguinis chriſtin actione myſticâ celebratur againe permanent proprietate naturae sacrament body blood chriſt divine thing yet ceaſe bee nature ſubſtance bread wine anſwer whereunto foreſaidbellar baton quo ſupra dicit gelaſius divinaru tranſcunt spiritu ſancto perficiente ſubſtantiam permanent tamen ſuâ pro •• etate naturae may bee ſeene indeed gelaſius latine author greeke theodoret latine language ſo perfect uſe word equivocall • yet ſo matter ſelfe doth challenge proper uſe thereo hee ſpeaketh subſtancè bread confutation whoſoever writeth againſt ſame eutychian hereſie theodoret thereupon uſeth accordingly like advantage word subſtance nature ſame ſenſe theodoret ſaith true therefore muſt wee aſſure ſelves conſent gelaſius u untill ſhall able free ſelves former interpretation theodoret maſter brerely oppoſeth againſt u another ſentence gelaſius whence concludeth gelaſius held tranſubſtantiation ſo gelaſius muſt rather contradict himſelfe ſhall conſent romiſh tenet whereas indeed ſaith myſticall ſenſe proteſtant muſt allow viz sacrament divine thing whoſoever eate ſpiritually body chriſt made partaker bleſsing divine nature dwelleth christ bodily ſaith apoſtle gelaſius whereof copiouſly throughout fift booke saying gelaſius touching euchariſt anſwerable like saying gregory nyſſen concerning grace infallible ſignification thereof hee well aſwell infallible signification grace efficacious conveyance grace worke ſame omnipocencie purpoſe plainly engliſh cardinall alan ſpeaking hee ſaith judgement divine card alan de sacram gen c 17 18 sacramenti inſtitutionem neque ad pontificem ne que ad ullam creaturam pertinere nec hoc ſolum ſed etiam c—propter ſolam ſignificationem gratiae quam sacramentis omnibus communem diximus • bebant etiam vetera sacramenta determinari per applicationem mortis chriſti quia licet quidem creaturis ad ſignationem effectuum ſpiritualium aptitudo quaedam ſit tamen iſta aptitudo non niſi divinâ inſtitutione determina • ur ad peculiarem effectum habet enim aqua ex natura ſua ut munditiem ſignificet ut determinatè purgationem animae à peccato originali ſignificet hominis ſanctificationem repraeſentet divinae tantùm inſtitutionis eſt per quam elevatur creatura haec ſupra naturae conſuetudinem non ſolùm quoad vim operandi ſed etiam ſignificandi non poteſt sacramentum niſi à ſolo deo ordinari quià habent sacramenta supernaturalem effectum ut veteri lege quae debant munditiem legalem theſe hee ſaith ſpeaketh ex theologorum sententia telleth although aptneſſe every creature beare ſignification ſome ſpirituall effect yet cannot aptneſſe determinatly applyed unto peculiar effect ſo much ſignifie outward cleanneſſe man body sacramentally without divine inſtitution much leſſe repreſent man ſanctification ſo determinated ordained god creature ſaith hee elevated cuſtome nature reſpect worke ſanctification even ſignification alſo hee well conceditur—regeneratio intelligitur quia eſt nam ſi incorporeus eſſes incorporea tibi tradidiſſet dona quoniam verò anima conjuncta eſt corpori ſenſibilibus intelligibilia tibi tradidit chr • ſoſtome idem gregorius oratione catechetica cap 37 multa habet expreſsè de veritate hujus hic locus ab euthymio dicit corpus chriſti immortale cum noſtro corpore mortali conjungi immortale per illud reddi quod corpus noſtrum ingrediens terum ſe transfert commutat—deinde ſe explicat—dicit hoc fieri divinâ virtute explicat ſeipſum dicit enim nunc panem mutart carnem chriſti quemadmodum dum adhuc terris eſſet mutabatur panis quo ipſe veſcebatur carnem ipſius quae • ſunt perſpicua ut non fuerit auſus ullus adverſariorum quòd ſciam vel ad haec • oca reſpondere vel aliquid ex hoc authore nobis objicere commentum—nam diſputatio tantùm erat quibus verbis fieret tranſubſtantiatio ſeu conſecratio gordon would qualifie mince buſineſſe yet binius publiſher councell binius tom 4 conc florent seſſ 25 vobis corpus meum • illam locutionem retinuerunt quae nihil juvat hodier • o pō tificios quia aliud eſt uſurpare loq • endi modum quo uſus chriſtus aliud definire quomodò 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 explicandus ſit ille modus—fateor veteres patres aliquandò videri tale quid sacramento agnoſcere ſed ſi verba eorum accuratè expendantur planè apparebit praeſentiam chriſti eos agnoviſſe abſque hoc myſterio tranſubſtantiationis iuſtinus utitur exemplo incarnationis ſed nihil hoc ad tranſub nam deus cùm aſſumpſit carnem non eſt muratus carnem ne que deſijt eſſe quod erat—patres 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 agnoviſſe ſed variè expoſ • ſſe planè contra rom eccleſiae ſententiam—greg nyſſ et alij patres qui 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 adſtruunt utuntur exemplis quae tranſubſtantiationem deſtruunt ut aqua baptiſmo ſaxi altari idiotae sacerdotem noſtri filios lucis qui eramus filij tenebrarum accedant loca patrum ubi diſertè negatur 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 aut 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 —patres sacramento agnoverunt 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 rem ſymbolis ſignificatam quae cum symbolis exhibetur per symbola—ſaepe igitur cum chriſto loquuntur ſed nunquam adjiciunt interpretationem quae ſtabiliat doctrinam • tranſubſt de accidentibus ſine ſubſtantiâ—patres perceptionem hujus myſterij tribuerunt fidei ità tamen ut o non excluderent proprer symbola—sunt qui putent quoties inveniunt apud patres ſumi corpus chriſti aut praeſentem eſſe chriſtum aut ut loquitur chryſoſt tom front p 43 chriſtum reliquiſſe nobis ſuum corpus id genus ipſiſſimam eſſe doctrinam pontificiorum fed falluntur obſervandum enim patres ſtudioſe ſervàlle genus loquendi quo uſus eſt chriſtus ſervavit apoſt ſed modum non expoſuiſſe—patres de hoc myſterio ejus effectu cum ſentirent auguſtiſſimè multi ſunt ejus commendatione ſuis illis hyperbolis hoc argumento habenas ſuas laxârunt de effectu dixerunt hominem fieri deum per hoc sacramentum vide excerpta è dionyſ areop de ſcopo sacramenti hujus ad dionyſium notata p 33 de sacramento euchariſtiae quod putabant eſſe cauſam inſtrumentalem effectus pari magnificentia locutiſunt father touching expoſition chriſts word body father ſaith uſed ſame forme ſpeech chriſt done doth whit helpe papiſts becauſe one thing uſe ſame phraſe ſpeech another thing define expounded ſpeake tranſmutation change ſo expound themſelves word make plainly againſt doctrine church rome ii vſing example deſtroy tranſubſtantiation namely change water baptiſme laicks prieſt iii acknowledged ſenſible signe thing ſignified thereby never teach thing whereby either tranſubſtantiation accident without ſubſtance eſtabliſhed iv attributed participation mysterie unto faith yet ſo excluding receiving mouth reſpect symbol somethinke father ſay chriſt preſent hee hath left u body like thereby meane doctrine papiſts deceived v father one conſent teach ſame change tranſmutation water baptiſme bread euchariſt vi hyperbole exceſsive ſpeeches father preſſed dionyſius areopagita ſaying man sacrament made god thus farre orthodoxe learned author juſtifying effect much hitherto v hath beene avouched antiquity sixtly vnconſcionableneſſe romiſh oppoſites doth betray ſelfe alleging teſtimonies father contrary owne romiſh principle sect x romiſh poſitions principle theſe one ioſephus angle flor theolog qu 5 art 1 diſp 3 conclu 1 panis fit corpus chriſti eſt falſa poſitio quià non ſuſcipit corpus chriſti formam panis conclu 2 panis mutatur corpus chriſti falſa eſt propoſitio quià hac converſione nullum ſubjectum manet nulla intervenit mutatio nempè corporis chriſti sic ille aquinas part 3 qu 75 art 8 hoc sacramento factâ converſiont aliquid idem manet ſ • ilicet accidentia panis ſecundum quandam ſimilitudinem harum locutionum aliquae poſſunt concedi ſcil quod de pane fit corpus chriſti ut nomine panis non intelligatur ſubſtantia panis ſed univerſali hoc quod ſub ſpeciebus panis continetur—et paulo poſt ad 1 non tamen proprie dicitur quod panis fiat corpus chriſti niſi ſecundùm aliquam ſimilitudinem ut dicitur vaſquez 3 thom qu 75 art 8 diſp 181 cap 14 verum cum jam à nobis notatum eſt verbum fieri praedictis propoſitionibus non ſumi propriè pro aliqua corporis chriſti productione ſed pro eo quod eſt corpus chriſti adduci ſeu fieri praeſens sacramento ex hac parte nihil difficultatis eſt praedictis annuntiationibus—panis fit corpus chriſti melius docent tho rich gabr sotus ledeſma hanc propoſitionem eſſe falſam ſi ſecundùm proprietatem vocum accipiatur et ratio manifeſta eſt quià cum aliquid dicitur fieri aliud debet eſſe aliquod commune ſaltem materia ſub utro que termino tranſmutationis hic autem nihil manet commune niſi accidentia quae non fiant corpus chriſti ſed continent aegidius coninck de sacramentis qu 75 art 8 de pane ſit corpus chriſti ex pane fit corpus chriſti rigore ſunt falſae ſi apud patres inve •• antur piè explicandae ſunt patres catachreſi uſos eſſe propoſition bread made body chriſti falſe ſay doctor method ſake firſt handled booke ſecond followeth chap ſtate point controverſie notwithſtanding difference opinion chriſts preſence onely de modo maner yet may romiſh doctrine hereticall hold contrary pernitious paradoxe sect would wonder u heare owne profeſſion ſo extremely indifferent concerning different opinion maner preſence chriſts body sacrament thinke romiſh sect therefore either tollerable reconciliable upon pretence queſtion onely de modo maner conſequently controverſie vaine langling one ought enter ſecond thought conſider neceſſity lyeth upon every chriſtian abandon diver hereſies haec eſt eorum ſententia licet chriſti corpus corporaliter eſſentialiter ſit coelo nihilominus duplici modo hoc sacramento verè percipi ſpiritualiter ſacramentaliter ſpiritualiter quidem ore mentis fallacem oculis figuram proponi dicimus ſed pignus nobis porrigi cui re ipſa veritas conjuncta eſt quòd ſcilicet chriſti carne sanguine animae noſtrae paſcantur ibid pag 44 sacram unitatem quam no habemus cum chriſto ſenſui carnis incomprehenſibilem fatemur eſſe ibid 45 spiritualem cùm dicimus fremunt quaſi hac voce realem ut vulgò vocant tollamus no verò ſi reale pro vero accipiant ac fallaci author collius ſpeaking unto higher ſtraine margin wee ſhall render unto engliſh firſt generall declamation idem collius lib 4 cap 3 diſp 9 cujus • ures auaire non refugiunt ſanguinem chriſti poſt glorioſam à motrus reſurrectionem è naturalibus venarum conceptaculis non ſemel diſtractū fuiſſe imò quis non perhorreſcit hoc intelligere—cum compertum ſit diuturnitate temporis evaneſcere ſeu ut verius dicam contabeſcere id quod • b alenſe verus ſanguis chriſti putatur—cap 4 quanquam poſſit hoc deus potenti virtutis imperio tamen tutiſſime videtur aſſerendum nunquam ſpectaſſe mortales oculos verum salvatoris noſtri ſanguinem poſtquam triumphator caelos penetravit—cap 5 sol •• igitur ſententia thomae tenenda juxtà concordem inſignium theologorum ſententiam cruorem ex ſacra synaxi emergentem non eſſe ex chriſti venis hauſtum—cap 6 • non eſt verus chriſti ſanguis ille miraculoſus cujus tandem conditionis et naturae eſt belluarumnè hominum potius num à deo recenter creatus ſolummodo commentitius fictitius ſanguis—si per longa inter valla durat verus eſt ſanguis—cap 7 sanguis qui breviſſimo tempore vel tranſcu • u cernitur non v • u ſed adu • bratus ſanguis duntaxat puta • • eſt whoſe eares abide heare blood chriſt glorious reſurrection ſeparated naturall receptacle veines yea without horror thinke therof eſpecially ſeeing experience telleth u ſame blood appeared vaniſh away putrifie corrupt wherfore ſafeſt reſolution according conſent divine affirme mortall eye man ever behold trv • blood chriſt ſince triumphant piercing heaven hitherto publike profeſſor according herein thomas aquinas hee calleth angelicall doctor famous divine preſently whereas cited doctor furthermore conclude none thoſe apparition beene true fleſh onely shaddowes repreſentations thereof hee craveth leave depart affirming although true fleſh chriſt yet true fleſh leaveth queſtioning againſt aſſertion concerning theſe miraculous apparition true fleſh might whether fleſh • ſts man whether newly created commentitiouſly obtruded hee anſwereth yet ſo whereas story reporter worſhippers ſuch apparition equally eſteeme like truely fleſh hee teacheth diſtinguiſh apparition ſaid vaniſhed ſhortly firſt ſhew longer continuance • acknowledge exiſtence true fleſh onely second kinde laſt place oppoſing againſt generall opinion thomas choiceſt divine abovementioned held theſe meerly apparition without subſtance fleſh hee albeit granting fictitious apparition may truly miraculous yet make ſame opinion ridiculous breaketh inveigheth manerquo • ſunt c 6 contra eos qui dicunt tantùm fictitum eſſe ſanguinem illum qui per long interva •• corſpicitur idē author collius quis ſibi perſuadere poterit largiſſimos rubri coloris liquores qui ex ſacra menſa non ſemel eruperunt nulla procreata ſubſtantia eff • uere vaſa que calices implerè poſſe certe capiant ſi liber iſtud credant alij mihi enim uti captu ita creditu ſemper difficillimum viſum eſt—qui • • n paulò poſt credant illa accidentia eſſe qu • ſia fides catholica conſecrati calicis euchariſtia ſcimus eſſe—cap 7 ego opinor baſim ac firmamentum accidentium ſanguinis ijs ipſis accidentibus quae calice ſuperſunt aſcribendum eſſe perſwade himſelfe ſuch abundance l • quor red colour ſaid iſſued euchariſt filling chalice veſſels ſhould wholly fictitious accident without subſtances let others underſtand believe pleaſe part muſt confeſſe alwayes beyond capacity credulity doctor ſuppoſed miraculous apparition notwithſtanding hath foundation either scripture tradition primitive church chriſt meere accident without subſtance ſaith believeth hath believeth declameth againſt heard ii ſame author diſcourſe upon romiſh story concerning mentioned reliques chriſts blood iſſued miraculouſly image sect vii vvhereas aquinas others many hiſtories approved many apparition blood great abundance mantua venice rome elswhere flowing image doctor concludeth himſelfe idem collius lib 5 diſp 8 cap 2 verum chriſti sanguinem terus eſſe memoriae atque literis proditum eſt—cap 3 quid de • ti hiſtoriis cenſen • • um ſit— sicut certam mihi elicere poſſe videar aſſertionem non nihil iſtius ſanguinis chriſti apud no remanſiſſe ita adduci non poſſum ut aſſentiar tantam effuſi ſanguinis copiam qualis ea eſſe convincitu • ex ii • bſque certo naturae chriſti rèviviſcentis detrimento abſolutae corporis chriſti perfectioni repugnante—difficile eſt ſatiſfacere ijs omnibus qui de vero chriſti ſanguin • gloriantu • cùm •• n cui • pulchrum ſit ut f • rt proverb • um ut quiſpiam p • udens inducet animum ſuum credere tot vaſcula ſacro domini cruore referta nunc etiam terris reperiri—si quis credit audiat illam infignem ſententiam qui citò credit levi eſt corde cap 4 objectis rationibus reſpondetur cap 5 cum fide catholica repugnet nihil ſanguinis chriſti tem anſiſſe terris—cardinalis sancti petri ad vin putat non ſine haereſi negari poſſe—ex teſtimonio bulla pij secundi pontificis ex revelatione brigittae alij alij ut thomas affirmat de ſanguine chriſti nutrimentali non de vitali ſed diſtinctio haec inanis—ob athanaſius de paſſione imaginis domini cap 7 sanguis dominicus c cujus authoritas approbata eſt ſeptimo synodo nvcena act 4 quibus rationibus angelicus doctor quodilibet 5 3 •• dem cap refert ad ſanguinem chriſti ſed ego minime ſubſcribendum eſſe arbitor ob leo tertius reſpondeo non verum chriſti ſanguinem manituae exiſtentem fuiſſe à leone comprobatum ſed fuit certa inventi liquoris approbatio utpote qui veneratione dignus imò etiam pium videri iſtum liquorem ut chriſti ſanguinem p • c colendum ob sol diploma pij secundi tantum dicit non repugnare fidei doctrinae ſanguinem chriſti aliquem relictum eſſe terris ob sol non ſolum probabilis ac vera propemodum opinio eſt eam hiſtoriam de percuſſu imaginis chriſti non fuiſſe athanaſt • magni ſed alterius doctoris ejuſdem nominis—quae tamen ſi ejus fuiſſe dicatur—tamen unius sancti patris authoritas ad r • tanquam de fide ſtabiliendam non ſufficiet—et approbatio synodi nycenae ſecundae non eſt exiſtimanda cadere totum ac ſingulas iſtius hiſtoriae partes ſed ſolum quadrare hiſtoriam perfoſſae imaginis c quod ad brigittae revelationem ſpectat etſi ſit e • maximi ponderis tamen non tan • tamque efficacis cenſenda eſt ut ab ea diſcedere impium ac ••• ligioſum fuit albeit portion blood chriſt might ſayd remaine earth yet thought ſuch copious meaſure blood reported ſhould bin becauſe although country glory boaſt ſuch reliques chriſts blood proverb every one thinketh ovvne best yet could ſo great quantity blood filled whole veſſels ſayd iſſue christ body without ſome iujury perfection glorious body therefore hee ſhall beleeve let heare notable ſaying solomon hee ſodaine beliefe hath light inconſtant heart occaſion queſtion thus proſecuted ſtart another hare queſtioning whether bee matter faith beleeve blood ſo appearing blood chriſt one ſide affirming grounding themſelves thought upon bull pope rome upon pretended teſtimonie athanaſius upon divine revelation saint bridget contrary ſide doctor qualifieth approbation pope excepteth againſt pretended teſtimony athanaſius juſtly counterfeit denieth revelation saint bridget ſufficient prove impious irreligious beleeve contrary iii third point blood chriſt ſhed paſsion wee leave id diſp 9 cap 2 portio aliquas de ſanguine effuſo paſſione omnipotentem quià poteſt ad omne quod non implicat contradictionem quae ponit eſſe non eſſe ſimul proindè ſi illud fieret fieret aliquid cujus eſſe eſſet non eſſe c bellar lib 3 de euch cap 2 § alio igitur idem adverſarij conveniunt hoc id non poſſe fieri quod implicat contradictionem ibid ipſa contradictio cō ſiſtit eſſe non eſſe si deus haberet eſſe conjunctum cùm non eſſe non eſſet deu • si non eſſet deus non eſſet omnipotens quare poſſe facere quod implicat contradictionem eſt deum poſſe non eſſe omnipotentem mal • ieſ tom 1 de euch qu 1 p 153 perer ieſ genae 7 initio divine affirme ſay inquiunt non faciat deus ut caro eadem diverſa loca occupet ut nullo loco contineatur ut modo ſpecie careat inſane quid à deo poſtulas ut carnem ſimul faciat eſſe non carnem perinde ac ſi inſtes ut lucem ſimul lucem faciat ac tenebras ibid § 26 corpus chriſti ex quo reſurrexit non ariſtoteles ſed spiritus sanctus finitum eſſe tradit coelo contineri uſque ad ultimum diem et § 30 cujus ergô aequè ejus potiamur praeſentiâ e • § 36 vt chriſtum illie ritè apprehendant piae animae coelum erigantur necelle eſt untruly alſo doth hee allege bucer beza farel pag 237 ſame ſenſe carvin mr foxe inficiatus eſt quod cum credere n • luit tollit ab omnipotenti virtute salmer ieſ tom 9 tract 23 p 173 ieſuite salmeron bitterly taxeth beza contrarily holding impoſsible one body two place therefore calleth apoſtata whombeza cum adverſarijs congreſſus ubi calvini myſteria non poſſet defendere eam prorupit blaſphemiam ut deum neget omnipotentem diſertè enim ſcribit deum non poſſe officere ut corpus aliquod manente ſubſtantiâ ſit abſ que loco vel pluribus locis ſimul illud enim angeli axioma apud deum nihil eſt impoſſibile non ſine ex • p • ione accipiendum eſſe quod factum fieri nequit infectum—o argutos philoſophos qui dei majeſtatem ad ſuas phyſicas regulas non erub • ſcunt revocare frateol elench haereſ lib 2 tit bezanitae another termeth ſame cauſe blaſphemous indeed deny omnipotencie god whereas according former propoſition rather defend becauſe god god truth one truth without contradiction neceſſarily implyed doctrine locall preſence one body many place next place evinced ſame second romiſh contradiction holding preſence one body many place proved nature diſtinct place one time making one one sect ii firſt place hearken aquinas chiefeſt doctor ever poſſeſſed romiſh schoolecatholici iſti cum thoma quartum diſtinct 14 art 2 hanc rationem cut non poſſit corpus chriſti localiter eſſe c—quod ſi verò non poſtic corpus chriſti localiter eſſe diverſis locis qu • à divideretur à ſeipſo profectò nec poſſit sacramentaliter eſſe eadem ratione qui licet dicat hoc non eſſe per locus occupationem tamen dicit per realem veram praeſentiam plariribus hoſtijs ſive altaribus quae realis praeſentia tot altaribus non loc • intermedijs non minùs tollere videretur indiviſionem rei bel lib 3 de euch cap 3 pag 491 quidam catholici atque eis sanctus thomas exiſtimant non poſſe unum corpus eſſe ſimul diverſis locis localiter quià • mquiunt unum eſt ill • quod indiviſum 〈◊〉 quocunque alio bellar quò ſuprà poſſible miracle body chriſt locally many place becauſe includeth contradictio making one one divided ſelfe hee together others call catholikes conclude impoſsible body chriſt locally diver place ⚜ beſides sentence wherein hee holdeth aquin supplem 3 part qu 83 art 3 ad 4 dicendum quod corpus chriſti localiter diverſis locis non poteſt fieri der miraculum—quia eſſe pluribus locis ſimul repugnat individuo ratione ejus quod eſt en • individuum ſe— includit contradictionem ſicut quòd homo careat ratione et qu 8 • art 2 ad 1 corpus non poteſt actu eſſe pluribus locis ſimul hoc enim eſt ſolius dei poſsibility proper god though hee ſpeake quaeſtionem utrum cum diverſis locis fiant miracula ad memorias alicujus martyris ſit ipſe praeſens uno tempore tàm multis locis iſta fiant miniſterio angelorum et reſpondet hanc quaeſtionem eſſe ſupra ingenij vires—praetereà cap 17 refert hiſtoriam quandam iohannis qui cum ex monaſterio ſuo non diſceſſiſſet apparuit tamen adhuc vivens ſomnis cuidam alteri longè poſito ac deinde dicit dubium eſſe ſpiritus ejus reverà fuiſſet utroque loco id eſſe factum alſo modo si inquit interfuit ſomnianti mirabili gratiâ id quidem potuit non naturâ c bellarmine proofe ſame body chriſt might appeare teſtimonium non probat de corpore quoad extenſionem ad locum ſed de exiſtentia animae duobus locis ſimul ne que amplius probat alterum illud auguſtini de iohanne monacho ubi agitur de ſpiritu see aquinas viz implyeth contradiction ſay body corporally two place becauſe maketh one body one confeſſed alſo heard cardinall making conſequence viz ſame reaſon muct follow abſolutely impoſsible beſides action quality whereof ſome relative reſpect ſome place others abſolutes relative determined vnum corpus diverſis locis poſitum unum habet eſſe ſubſtantiale ſed multa habet eſſe localia ex quo fit ut omnia multiplicari debeant quae conſequuntur eſſe locale illa autem non multiplicantur quae aliunde proveniunt relationes verò ad loca neceſſariò multiplicantur propter dimenſiones locorum itaque erit idem corpus ſurſum deorſum propinquſi remotum poterit moveri locum quieſcere alio loco nec tamen implicatur ulla contradictio illa enim dicuntur contradicentra quae conveniunt uni reſpectu eodem eodem tempore modo loco ac nè id mirum videatur anima humana quae tota eſt toto corpore quolibet membro corporis certè ut eſt capite eſt remota à terra ut pedibus propinqua ut brachio quieſcere dicitur ut altero mo • movere bellar lib 3 de euch cap 4 § ac primum one body ſay diverſe place might right hand left behind ſelfe may move move ſame inſtant without contradiction becauſe ſo ſaid diver reſpects corpore ſive actiones ſint ſive qualitates ſive quae unque alia non multiplicātur ratio quà corpus unum eſt non multa ut ſi corpus chriſti uno loco calefiat alio erit calidum ſi uno loco vulneretur altero erit vulnerarum bellar lib 3 de euch cap 4 actus contrarij ut amoris odij aſſenſus diſſenſus non poſſunt competere uno ſubjecto diverſis locis quia vitales actiones proficiſcuntur ex potentiae naturali ut à principio agente eadem potentia non habet vim naturalem ad efficiendum actus contrarios—ratio inter actus cortrarios—tantam eſſe repugnantiam ut etiam per potentiam dei abſolutam non poſſibile eſſe corpus habere diverſa accidentia ut movere uno quieſcere alio aut contrario motu moveri videtur omninò inconceptibile quià quieſcere dicit expreſſè negationem motus que ità moveri quieſcere ſunt contradictoria vel reſponderi poteſt haec dici de eodem ratione diverſorum ubi • quod nullo modo dicendum quia frigere calere non conveniunt ſubjecto raiione locus ſed ratione ſui confirmatur 1 quia album dum movetur ſemper ſecundum aliud aliud eſſe album 2 quia diverſa ubi cùm ſint mera accidentia non magi multiplicant ſubjectum ſecundum ſe quàm alia accidentia 3 quia diverſa ubi ſunt ſibi mutuò modi repugnantes non minus quàm calor frigus—vnde ſequeretur ut ſi homo qui hoc mundo poſitus eſſet diverſis locis virtute naturali non poſſet moveri niſi utrinque locum amittat one body everywhere becauſe divine property father ſufficiently prove godhead holy ghoſt namely auguſtine fulgentius ambroſe baſil father prove thinke good owne author ſilent wee heard ſome themſelves ſpeake fulgent ad tra ſimud lib 2 pag 325 spiritus sancti nobis habitatio non localis eſt inhabitat enim tunitas ſu • fidelibus ſicut tota cunctis nec per ſeparatos homines ſeparata loca particulariter ſeparatur fulgentius reaſon becauſe spirit god dwelleth wholly faithfull ſeparated diver place baſu de spir sancto cap 22 ſub finem reliquae virtutes omnes loco circumſcriptae eſſe credūtur nam ange lu qui • aſtabat cornelio non erat eodem loco quo cùm aſt •• philippo neque qui locutus eſt zacha • iae ab altari per idem tempus etiam coelo ſuam implebat ſtationem spiritus sanctus ſimul abaccuc operatus dancle babylonia creditus cata • cta cum ieremia cum ezechiele chobar spiritus enim domini replevit orbem terrarum quo igbo • spiritu tuo et propheta quoniam ego inquit vobiſcum ſum spiritus meus ſtat medio veſtri baſil thus angell cornelius ſame time philip hee heaven zachary altar holy ghoſt together prophet daniel babylon ieremy dungeon ezechiel chobar ambroſ de sp sancto lib 1 cap 7 cum igitur omnis creatura certis naturae ſuae circumſcripta limitibus ſiquidem illa inviſibilia opera quae non queunt locis finibus comprehendi ſubſtantiae tamen ſuae proprietate clauduntur quomodo quis audeat creaturam sp sanctum appellare qui non habet circumſcriptam determinatam naturam ideò cum dominus ſervos ſuos apoſtolos deſtinare voluit ut agnoſceremus aliam eſſe naturam aliud gratiam ſpiritualem alios aliòo deſtinabat quia ſimul omnes eſſe ubique non poterant • dedit autem spiritum sanctum qui licet ſeparatis apoſtolis inſeparabilis • gratiae munus inſunderet quis igitur dubitat quin divinum ſit quod inſunditur ſimul pluribus nec videtur corporeum autem quod videtur à ſingulis tenetur ambroſe thus becauſe apoſtles could every chriſt ſevered giving holy ghoſt inſeparable none therefore doubt divine eſſence sauguſt contra maxim arian epiſt lib 3 cap 21 cum ſic laudetis spiritum sanctum ut ſanctificandis fidelibus ubique praeſentem eſſe dicatis tamen negare audeatis eſſe deum vbique ſpoken faithfull hath ſenſe vbicunque becauſe number faithfull finite place diſtinct abſolutely every auguſtine confuteth arian biſhop thus prayſe holy spirit ſanctifying faithfull whereſoever deny god ⚜ saint hilary evince chriſt divine spirit uſeth argument hilarius pſ 124 illo verba chriſti ecce ego vobiſcum ſum uſ que ad conſummationem ſeculi spiritus layet downe prove neceſſary chriſt body ſhould ſelfe according nature body diſtinct part head eye organ fit uſe reaſonable soule taketh magnitude extenſion part proportionable length breadth depth ſaith inſeparably united chriſt body owne intrinſecall diſpoſition ſelfe ſo ſaith regard place challenge owne reaſon may wee juſtly retort upon ſelves proving naturall diſpoſition body chriſt thus proportionably extended ſelfe muſt ſo likewiſe reſpect place space becauſe three dimenſions body chriſt confeſſed ſtand thus one extenſion length another breadth third depth theſe three diſtinct one another well arme muſt thus farre longer foot legge thus farre thicker finger hand thus farre broader toe accordingly diſtinctly part hîc huc • ſque thus farre ſo farre relative space place demonſtratively ſhew extenſion diſtinct part body themſelves diviſibly ſame muſt neceſſarily reſpect vbi place space wherein body therefore heretically teach mathematicall phantaſticall body • chriſt muſt deny article trent untill beleeve make good part diviſible body longer ſhorter broader narrower equally one indiviſible point confirmed eſſence chriſt glorified body confeſſe heaven poſſeſſing reall place ſayd proportion space length breadth upon earth doth naturall magnitude quantity thereof ſayd naturall magnitude quantity ſayd body chriſt according wone generall doctrine sacrament therefore muſt ſame commenſuration space although ſame space one earth wee ſhould loath trouble wit theſe ſpeculations neceſſity cauſe reaſon abſurdities romiſh profeſſion inforce u hereunto therefore muſt ſuffer u little ſport trifling ſeriouſneſſe writing divine sacrament ſeeing round ſolid broken moulded one kind liquid frozen ſowring attribute theſe quantity quality accident without ſubject vi profeſſion beene catholike doctrine doubtleſſe auguſtine ſo devout fervent meditation upon holy myſtery would oppugned hee unto queſtion voluſianus whether bodie chriſt birth fill body bleſſed virgin hee anſwered aug nullum corpus poteſt eſſe ubique totum quantumcun que corpus vel quantulumcun que corpuſculum locus occupet ſpacium eundemquè locum ſic occupet ut nulla ejus parte ſit totum neceſſe eſt longè alia natura eſt animae quàm corporis quanto magi dei lib 1 ep 3 ad voluſian whoſe queſtion auguſtine vtrum chriſtus intemeratae foeminae corpus impleverit every body greater leſſe whereſoever muſt need fill ſpace wherein ſo ſame body cannot whole part thereof hee directly contradictory article trent expreſſe mention relation place space whereas uſuall colour poſsibility whole body chriſt every part hoaſt objected example man soule ſayd whole every member part body saint auguſtine hee foreſeene myſtery errour preoccupateth ſaying eo quod dicitur deus ubique carnali cogitationi reſiſtendum eſt men acorporis ſenſibus amorenda ne quaſi ſpacioſa magnitudine opinemur deum per cuncta diffundi ut aër aut lux omnis enim hujuſmodi magnitudo minor ſua parte quà toto ſed ita potius ut eſt magna ſapientia etiam homme cujus corpus eſt parvum—n • ſi duo ſint homines aequal • er ſapientes quorum alter eſt corpore grandi • r non plus ſapiunt ambo quam ſinguli ſic minore corpore non minor eſt ſani ta cum minora majora corpus tam ſan • ſine—diſp • r eſt profecto membrorū molibus quantitas ſed par eſt diſparatis ſanitas—quae non quantitas ſed qualitas eſt non pot •• ergo obtinere quantitas corporis quod qualitas aug epiſt 57 ad dardan nature soule farre different nature body againe ſame holy father ſeeking find ſome similitude whereby wholly reſemble exiſtence god reſpect place end ſaith quality hath prerogative make ſome similitude hereof hee doth inſtance wiſedome ſaith hee great little man great man denyeth quantity hath ſuch privilege ſpeaking quantity magnitude ſuch quantity magnitude ſaith hee leſſe part whole ſame maxime concerning whole reſpect place hee diſtinguiſheth godhead manhood confounded yet againe elſewhere though hee thought deluſion could never ſufficiently contradicted rather derided hee ſo childiſh know idem minor eſt unus digitus quam tota manus minor eſt digitus unus quam duo alibi eſt iſte digitus alibi ille alibi coetera manus—nec ſolùm immobilibus corporis articulis—ſed etiam aëris partes ſuos implent locos—luciſ que par alia infunditur per hanc feneſtram alta per aliam major per majorem per minorem autem minor idem viſibilis aeſtimanda hoc myſterio ſed virtu 〈◊〉 ſpiritualis 〈…〉 non eſt quantitas aeſtimanda ut ſub minori quantitate minus ſic corpus chriſti ſub 〈◊〉 part chriſts body sacrament whole ſame reaſon manna whereof written hee gathered much others hee gathered ſo much whit leſſe romiſh gloſſe applyeth sacrament ſignifie leſſe quantity chriſts body leſſe quantity sacrament none greater greater anſwer threefold doctor could never yet prove writing goe name pope legat qai velit noſtri roberti coci cenſuram scriptorum decret epiſtles beene truly whereof many themſelves doubted ſome alſo denyed ii compariſon fighteth mainly againſt profeſſed romane faith point contend teach body chriſt whole whole every leaſt imaginable part hoaſt without maner ſituation therein ſo head feete cannot deny owne poſitive tridentine senſe manna diminiſhed augmented quantity god providence notwithſtanding certaine determinate quantitie expreſſely mentioned ſame text every man gomer according family namely every one equall yet ſeverall meaſure quantity one man manna ſame another agreeth corporall eating one ſame body chriſt next granes ſame manna like corianderſeed ſeverall ſituations diſtinct place every gomer ſome lying ſome ſome right ſide ſome left ſide meaſure difference abſolutely deny accord maner chriſts sacrament iii compariſon farre better ſuite spirituall ſoules receiving body chriſt every faithfull one indeed participating ſame whole chriſt faith whether greater leſſer hoaſt without proportioning bodily dimenſions ⚜ challenge shall novelty romiſh article ſo much beleeved romiſh doctor laſt age chriſtianitie shall contradiction owne romiſh principle shall expreſſe teſtimony saint auguſtine hee univerſally acknowledged catholike father ſo hee never condemned catholike father doctrine concerning exiſtence bodily part according proportionable dimenſions space finally ſhall affinity opinion hath damnable hereſies perſwade falſity romiſh faith chap ix fift romiſh contradiction againſt word chriſt body ſame body conſidered moſt perfect making moſt imperfect sect none thinke neede impoſe abſurd doctrine upon church abſurdities wee already heard profeſſed therin teſtifications owne diſputers beene ſo marvellouſly palpably abſurd hath beene ſhewne among wee may reckon followeth leaſt prodigious conſequence romiſh corporall preſence wit church rome alloweth doctrine teaching body chriſt glorified destitute naturall voluntary motion senſe vnderſtanding sect ii catholike faith never conceived otherwiſe humane nature chriſt reſurrection hee able naturally himſelfe hee man performe perfect act men right conſtitution body ſound underſtanding ſuch function iudgement reaſon appetite ſenſe motion according liberty owne doctrine thouſand yeeres catholike romane faith beleeve followeth concluſions ſet downe jeſuite suarez ieſ dico ſecundò corpus chriſti ut eſt hoc sacramento poteſt per ſe moveri localiter à deo loquor de potentia dei abſoluta nam juxta legem ſtatutam ſuppono corpus chriſti nunquam ſeparari à ſpeciebus nec moveri niſi motis illis—ne que hac concluſione invenies theologum ullum aperte contradicentem tertiam tho qu 76 art 7 diſput 32 conc 2 concluſ 3 corpus chriſti ut eſt hoc sacramento non poſſit naturaliter moveri localiter ab intrinſeco à propria anima interna virtute motiva naturall neque per ſe neque per accidens loquor de naturali virtute non ut eſt inſtrumentum verbi operans per virtutem miraculorum effectricem ratio quia non poteſt anima movere corpus ſuum niſi per membra organica quae habent extenſionem locum sed membra corporis chriſti non hoc modo exiſtunt hoc sacramento—multo minus poteſt movere ſpecies sacramentales quas nec phyſice contingere poſſit neque ad motum voluntatis movere ibid concluſ ult poteſt ut eſt hoc sacramento virtue extrinſeca moveri per accidens quia poſſunt sacramentales ſpecies moveri ut sacerdote elevando sect 3 de ſenſibus exterioribus nominales citati dicunt poſſe chriſtum ut eſt hoc sacramento ut deum audire c alij hoc negant sunt nonnulli qui negant id fieri poſſe de potentiâ dei abſolutâ ut corpus extenſum à loco aut ſeipſum videat aut alia dico non poteſt naturaliter exercere actus ſenſuum exteriorum ita tenet thomas alij authores—quia ſenſus ejus non poteſt recipere ſpecies ab objectis externis quia hic actus eſt materialis extenſus ſuâ naturâ—quamvis potentia abſoluta poteſt—idem dicendum de ſenſibus interioribus apetitu ſentiente quia non uti phantaſmatibus nec actum ſecundum elicere quia hic actus eſt materialis niſi à materiali extenſo principio non poteſt intellectus ejus ſecluſo miraculo—acquirere nova ſpecies nec prius exquiſitis uti quia intellectus hoc non poteſt facere niſi ſimul phantaſia operetur cum intellectu non loquor de ſpeciebus infuſis haec suarez 3 thom quaeſt 76 art 7 diſp 53 § 4 alſo vincentius silivitius seneſ ieſ moral quaeſt tom 1 tract 4 5 num 139 141 motus localis non convenit corpori per ſe non poſſunt actiones ſenſum convenire chriſto naturaliter quia hae exercentur per ſpecies ſubſtantia diviſibili chriſti corpus eſt sacramento indiviſibiliter c suarez romiſh doctor firſt chriſt hee sacrament hath power naturally himſelfe move himſelfe owne dayly experience hath brought unto whileſt beleeving chriſts corporall preſence hoaſt ſhut boxe ſtill find ſame lying deſtitute power motion unconſecrated bread put together lyeth ſo long untill equally waxe mouldy putrifie ingender wormes secondly chriſt himſelfe sacrament hath naturall faculty ſenſe abilitie without miracle heare ſee c thirdly hee voyd ſenſible appetite laſtly without ſome miraculous power hee cannot poſsibly apprehend underſtanding thing preſent yet remember notion paſt hee —ioſephus angle florent 4 sent qu de exiſtentia corporis chriſtia euch diſſio 1 2 • 9 12 corpus chriſti ut eſt hoc sacramento nec poteſt tangi nec per ſe nec per accidens quatenùs eſt euchariſtia non poteſt ullam ſenſationem accipere ratio quia omnis receptio ſpecierum quae eſt ſenſatio fit organo quantitativo nec agere nec pati poteſt nec actionem tranſientem agere communis opinio eſt scoti chriſtus non poteſt aliquam operationem potentiae merae naturalis ut eſt nutriendi ſentiendi habere ratio omne agens poſitivum agit per contactum quod eſt modo quantitativo art 12 oculus chriſti non videt ſuum corpus ut eſt hoc sacramento proptereà quod eſt inextenſum oculus eſt inextenſus scotus 4 sent diſt 10 quaeſt 5 nulla ſenſatio poteſt eſſe chriſto ut eſt euchariſtia petrus de aquilia doctrina scoti ſpectatiſsimus 4 sent diſt 10 quaeſt 1 quantitie bodie poſſeſſe place impoſsible chriſts body sacrament goe one place another impoſsible ſame bodie equall greater quantity many impoſſibilities reckoned upon ſame ground reaſon man could apprehend nothing ſuch point implication contradiction theſe great pillar chriſtianity well vniverſall church primitive romiſh muſt maſter fiſhers former aſſertion held beene better underminers chriſtian faith rather beleeve thoſe thing poſsible even becauſe ſeemed impoſsible reaſon contradiction laſtly come maſter fiſher owne praevarication mr fiſher anſwere 〈◊〉 upon ſeventh point • ommunion kind body chriſt ſaith hee without either blood soule unleſſe dead ſo ſhould chriſt maſſacred sacrament euchariſt bloody sacrifice christ glorious heaven cannot ſay truly body voyd soule blood senſe body yea calvin himſelfe confeſſeth abſurd maner ſpeech terme chriſt meere bodie chriſt hee whereupon hee found ſo implicated within hor • e dilemma hee cannot expedite himſelfe ſay good maſter fiſher ſhould chriſtian man ſayd rather beleeve doctrine becauſe ſeemeth abſurd wee ſpeake ſenſible object beleeve theſe abſurdities ſelfe ſo utterly therefore condemne indeed condemne becauſe ſeeme impoſſible abſurd broached doctrine rather beleeving thing becauſe ſeeming impoſsiblities eaſie patron abſurdities prove himſelfe notably abſurd maſter fiſher generall suppoſition reſpect qui ſumpſerit gravis farciminis onere premat nec quid indigeſticè vadat ſed animum alimoniâ ſpirituali reſiciat take little portion hoaſt namely ſay leſt otherwiſe belly taketh sacrament may ſtuffed divine adoration due unto therefore ought bid theſe romiſh doctrine deluſions avaunt objection former canon anſwered sect vi firſt ob 1 cum dicit agnum dei ſitū eſſe ſacra menſa eundem agnum opponit ſymbolis declarat agnum proprié eſſe menſa non ſolùm ut per ſymbola reprae ſentatur 2 agnus dicitur à sacerdotum manibus immolari quod non fit coelo neque enim tàm longas manus habent sacerdotes ut ad coelum pertingant 3 dicimur verè ſumere corpus chriſti quòd non ſolùm corde ſed corpore ſumitur probatur quia corpus ſanguis dom • ni dicuntur eſſe noſtrae reſurrectionis ſymbola quia cùm noſtris corporibus conjunguntur si autem ſol • eſſet animorum conjunctio ſolus animus reſurrecturus ſignific 〈◊〉 bellar lib 2 de euch c 10 object lambe ſaid placed table miſtaking table meant canon ſpecifying two table one euchariſt another table namely heaven ſaith chriſt placed table according faith ſitting right hand god heaven secondly hee ſaid ſay sacrifiſed hand prieſt cannot done hee heaven word canon truly reſolved caſhiere objection thus lambe god ſet table namely heaven ſacrifiſed hand prieſt wit table repreſentatively hereafter catholike father themſelves ſhew theſe two may eaſily conſiſt without neceſſitie prieſt reaching hand farre higheſt heaven cardinall objecteth ⚜ prieſt ſaith hee hath ſo long hand reach heaven hee delicately like romiſh cardinall carnally conceiting onely touch finger fleſh never regarding primitive doctrine touching chriſt faith whereof firſt saint ambroſe ambroſius luc 24 paulus docuit ubi te reperire poſſi ••• ubi ait si conſurrexiſtis cum chriſto quae ſurſum ſunt ſap •• e non ſuper terram ergo non quae ſupra terram nec terra nec ſecundum carnem te quaerere debemus ſi volumus invenire nunc enim ſecundum carnem jam non novimus chriſtum denique stephanus non ſupra terram quae 〈◊〉 qui ſtantem 〈◊〉 ad dextram dei vidit maria autem quae quaerebat terra tangere non potuit stephanus te • igit quia quaeſivit coelo many ſaith hee ſought chriſt earth could touch stephen touched ſought heaven conſonantly saint auguſtine queſtion mary touched chriſt earth mortall man ſhall touch heaven anſwereth aug tom 10 de temp serm 152 sin torra poſitum chriſtum maria non tangio coelo ſedentem quis mortalium poſſit tangere sed ille tactus fidem ſignificat tangit chriſta • qui credit eum touch faith hee believeth chriſt toucheth ⚜ thirdly allege wee ſaid chriſti animae noſtrae paſ • untur ſed ſecundùm virtutem non ſecundùm subſtantiam ii signum tantum p •• rigi centies contrà quaſi vero cum swinck •• ldio qui • quam nobis commune—iii catechiſmo diſſerui non ſolùm beneficiorum chriſti ſignificationem habemus coena ſed ſubſtantive participes nam cum eo vitam coaleſcimus—figurata locutio fateor modò non tellatur rei veritas iv neque enim tantùm dico applicari merita ſed ex ipſo chriſti corpore alimentum percipere anima non ſecùs ac terreno pane corpus veſcitur vim carnis ſuae viviſicans ſpiritus ſui gratiâ no transſ ſundit spiritualem dicimus non carnalem quamv •• realem ut haec vox provera contra fallacem ſumitur non ſecundùm ſubſtantiam quam vi ex ejus ſubſtantia vita anima noſtras proſ • uit v ergò coena miraculum agnoſcimus quod naturae ſines ſenſus noſtri modum ex ſupo • quod chriſti caro nobis ſit com nuuis nobis alimentum datu • —modus incomprehenſibilis vi si no conſeſu quem continet auguſtana confeſſio complexos eſſe dixi non eſt quod quis aſtutiae inſimule • verbulum ea confeſſione qualis ratisbonae edita fuit non extat doctrinae noſtrae con trarium de philippo melancthone ejus authore viro ſpectatae pietatis dico non magi à philippo quàm à proprijs viſceribus divelli poſſe et quidem non aliter ſanctae memoriae bucerum ſenſiſſe luculentis teſtimonijs probare mihi ſemper promptum erit lutherus meae ſententiae non ignarus propriâ tamen manu non gravatus eſt ſalutare quum marpurgi eſſem diconciliatio facta eſt ab eo conventu digreſſus affirmat codem quo ante loco oecolampadium zuinglium habere wilfullneſſe prophaned sacrament euchariſt inſtituted chriſt latter greater ſinner god judgeth ſinne onely secundum actum aut effectum according wicked deed done secundum affectum much according depraved affection▪ diſpoſition mind doer reſpect wee may well thinke iudas traiterous ſcornefull kiſſe hainous peter perjurie read apoſtle hath written againſt ſuch apoſtate faith vow baptiſme quacun que haereſi impietate • uerint reſpondendum eſt etiam ijs qui hanc liberationem polli centur ſolis catholicis quamvis malè viventibus qui non ſolo inquiunt sacramento ſed reipſa manducaverunt
