meam manet qui non manet chriſto proculdubio non mā ducat spritualiter carnem chriſti nec bibit ejus ſanguinem 〈◊〉 carnaliter viſibiliter prem dentſbus sacramentum corporis—tantae rei sacramentum ad judicium ſibi manducat hee abideth chriſt ſaith hee although hee preſſe teeth sacrament chriſts fleſh yet doth hee eat spirituall fleſh chriſt obſervable hee ſaith eat spiritually fleſh chriſt eat place saint auguſtine preſſeth adverſaries ſo hard refuge hee word saint auſtine ſpeaking moſes faithfull old teſtament eating manna ate chriſt spiritually therefore although died body yet died spiritually ſoules theſe aug 9 tract 26 ioh illi manducaverunt manna mor •• non ſunt quare quia viſibilem cibum ſpiritualiter intellexerunt nam hodiè viſibilem cibum accipimus sed aliud eſt sacramentum aliud virtu sacramenti quàm multi de altari accipiunt moriuntur unde dicit apoſtolus judicium ſibi manducant multi manducaverunt manna mortui non ſunt quare quia viſibilem cibum spiritualiter acceperunt—nam hodiè viſibilem cibum accipimus ſed aliud eſt sacramentum aliud virtu sacramenti quàm multi de altari accipiunt moriuntur many jewes ate manna died namely soule becauſe underſtood spiritually wee alſo day receive viſible meat sacrament one thing virtue sacrament another thing many receive altar die eate damnation themſelves hee namely ſay wee becauſe ate onely sacrament viſible meat virute bodie chriſt ſignified thereby paraphraſis saint auguſtine fully proteſtant profeſſing u wicked communicant eate body chriſt doctor make saint auguſtine flatly papiſt hic eſt panis qui de coelo deſcendit ut ſi quis manducaverit ex ipſo non moriatur sed quod pertinet ad virtutem sacramenti non quod pertinet ad viſibile sacramentum qui manducat intus non foris qui manducat corde non qui premat dente hee eateth ſo farre concerneth virtue sacrament cannot dye albeit otherwiſe reſpect eating onely viſible sacrament dye ſee none eate virtue hath beene confeſſed intelligunt nempè quia non credunt—ut propheta niſi credideritis non intelligetis aliquanto ſuperius illi putarunt illum erogatu • um corpus ſuum—ille autem dixit ſe aſcenſurum coelum—certe tunc corporali oculo quia ibi eſt per modum ſubſtantiae—ne que accidentia corporis chriſti habent immediatam habitudinem ad hoc sacramentum neque corpus quae circumſtant eum ad modum ſubſtantiae quae non generale romae laterano ad quod reus dicturus cauſam berengarius archidiaconus andegavenſ praeſente nicolao coram centum tredecim epiſcopis confeſſionem jurejurando firmavit—quibus verbis conceptum fuit ejuſmodi berengarij jusjurandum cum pleno cōcillo deteſtatus eſt errorem▪ fidemque catholicam profeſſus—ego berengarius—ore corde profiteor eam fidem tenere quam venerabilis papa nicolaus haec ſancta synodus tenendam tradidit panem vinum poſt conſecrationem non ſolùm sacramentum ſed etiam verum corpus ſanguinem domini noſtri ieſu chriſti eſſe ſenſualiter non ſolùm sacramento ſed veritate manibus sacerdotum tractari frangi fidelium dentibus atteri—hoc jusjurandum ab humbreto epiſcopo • • ſcriptum ab ipſo papa univerſoque concilio recognitum atque approbatum antea fuerat haec ex lanfranco—nicolaus papa ſcriptum ius • irandum iniſit per omnes urbes italiae galliae germaniae ad quaecunque loca quo fama berengari • pervenire potuit hactenus baronius cardinall baronius doth decree hath beene lately ratifyed bull pope gregory thirteenth ſame faith imbraced afterwar ••• d ſomewaldenſis ruardus scotus ſine ulla diſtinctione locutiones protulerunt nempe ita contrectari aftertimes yourquod ſi corpus chriſti euchariſtia editur certe frangitur dentibuſ que fidelium teritur utrumque enim cibo quem edimus conjunctum proprium loc theol lib 5 ca ult ſub finem canus aſſeverantly inferreth body chriſt eaten certainly broken torne teeth moſt emphatically cardinalltam miro modo corpus chriſti connectitur ſpeciebus ut unum ex ambobus fiat sacramentum—ex hoc ſequitur ſicut antea per eadem panis ita nunc corpus chriſti à nobis contrectari manducari carni noſtrae immiſceri dentibuſque teri hoc vel illo loco vaſe collocari quae omnia ſive per ſe ſive pe • accidens corpori chriſti sacramento competāt nihil refert modo certa fide credamus haec tam vere propriae fieri ac dici circa corpus chriſti quam ſi propria ſpecie eſſet non minus quam ſi ipſo panc fi • rent contr parmen altaribus chriſti membra ſunt portata—altare ſedes eſt corporis ſanguinis chriſti—immane facinus quando fregiſtis calices ſanguinis chriſti obijcit bellarm quo ſupra albeit ſame optatus paulò poſt iudaeos eſtis imitati illi injecerunt manus chriſto à vobis paſſus eſt altari idem ibidem altaria quibus membra chriſti portata ſunt—paulò poſt dum impiè perſequimini manus noſtras illic ubi corpus chriſti habitabat feciſtis veſtras hoc modo iudaeos imitati eſtis illi injecerunt manus chriſto cruce à vobis paſſus eſt altari member chriſt upon altar altar seat body blood bainous thing breake chalice blood chriſt c wee grant theſe phraſes optatus indeed objected ala maſters never learne dialect ancient father ſo many example light illuminate judgement wherein father done optatus inſtruct owne language preſently inveighing againſt ſame donatiſts ſaith chriſt beaten altar hee hyperbole making chriſt beaten wherewith hee ſayd chriſt ſeated altar yea member chriſt carried alſo ſame altar meaning thereby faithfull communicant confeſſed owne gabriel albiſpin epiſc aurelienſ illud caput membra chriſti praeter corpus chriſti quod altari offertur fideles etiam qui cum eo corpore ca 15 quod ſi quicquid o ingreditur ventrem abit ſeceſſum eijcitur et ille cibus ſanctificatus verbo dei juxta id quod habet materiale ventrem abit ſeceſſum • ijcitur caeterum juxta precationem pro proportione fidei factus ſit utilis efficiens ut perſpicax ſit animus nec materia panis ſed ſuper eo dictus ſermo prodeſt non indigne comedenti et hae • quidem de symbolico corpore multa porro de verbo dici poſſunt quod factum eſt caro veruſ que cibus quem qui comederit vivet aeternum materiall part meate sanctified prayer paſſeth draught ſaith hee ſpeake symbolicall bodie c place bellar iſta omnia recte intellig • poſſunt de euchariſtia—at materiale quod ſeceſſum abit ſunt accidentia non reſpectu formae naturalis ſed ſanctificationis magnitudinis nam magnitudo ad materiam potius pertinet quam ad formam—et per hoc quod symbolicum corpus vocat intelligit corpus chriſti ut eſt hic symbolum ſignum ſui • pſius ut • rat cruce lib 2 de euch cap • cardinalls crotchet confeſſing origen ſpoken symboll ſelfe croſſe meant croſſe origen intention throughout every part teſtimony firſt called bread hee calleth alſo meat sanctified secondly meat termeth materiall thirdly materiall ſaith paſſeth symbolicall body cardinall teacheth betoken chriſts owne naturall body immediatly maketh tranſition meate calleth true meate ſaith sequ • tur apud orig matth c 15 haec quidem de symbolico corpore ligandus veſtris viſceribus ſolvenduſquè ructatibus nam 〈◊〉 manducatis dei v • ſtri defectione vos reficitis cum digeritis illius refectione defici • tis—quomodo ergo comparas panem calicem noſtum parem religionem dicis • rrorem lo • ge 〈◊〉 veritate diſcretum pejus enim decipimus quam nonnulli qui no propter panem calicem cererem liberum colere exiſtimant—sicut enim cerere libero paganorum dijs longe abſumus quamvis panis calicis sacramentum quod ita laud 〈◊〉 ut eo nobis pares eſſe volueritis • itu noſtro amplectamur c edit pa • • ijs anno 1555 chriſt hanged every tree tyed unto meates eate would needes religion ſomewhat agreeable catholike profeſſion imputation saint auguſtine abhorre namely ſhould thought ſame reaſon concerning chriſts body opinion myſticall bread among orthodox man • chees corporall bread example chriſt ſhould faſtned tyed men gut eating let looſe againe belching hereticall doctrine ſhall accord romiſh hath affirmed paſſage entrance chriſts body cleaving unto men see chap 7 sect 1 gut eating repaſſe againe vomiting albeit matter ſo faſt ſo looſe judgement saint auguſtine bread ſtill conſecration second calumniation aginſt true profeſſours others teſtifyed catholikes euchariſt adored cere bacchus maner pagan anſwer thinke would romiſh profeſſour made caſe doubtleſſe according doctrine corporall preſence ſaying thus whereas ſome affirme wee adore bread wine sacrament yet truth wee adore whereunto bread wine tranſubſtantiated wit body blood chriſt ſonne god saint auguſtine one fancying nothing leſſe wee ſaith hee farre god pagan • ee embrace sacrament bread wine hee ſpake conſecration whereupon wee occaſioned admoniſh chriſtian reader take heed fraudulent practice romiſh sect becauſe abuſing writing ancient father whereof take unto preſent editio pariſ anno 1614 noſter panis—myſticus fit nobis corpus chriſti non naſcitui whereas direct ſenſe bread conſecrated naturally bread ſpicae eare • corne ſpoken mani chees made ſticall sacramentall cōſecration example paris edition 1555 hath sentence saint auguſtine thus noſter panis—myſticus fit nobis non naſcitur laſt paris edition ann 1614 hath foiſted inſerted corpus chriſt albeit ſenſe full without addition ſignifie common bread conſecration made myſticall sacramentall according saint auguſtines owne expoſition ſaying wee embrace sacrament bread cup alſo phraſe panis fit corpus chriſti bread made chriſts body repugnant common principle chriſtianity never believed body chriſt made bread aforeſayd addition correcting corrupting text ⚜ miſerable ſtraights romiſh diſputers anſwering definitive sentence saint auguſtine concerning chriſts word eating fleſh romiſh shift ſaying swallow sect iv saint aug de doctr chriſt lib 3 cap 16 si praeceptiva locut • flagitium aut facinus videtur jubere figurata eſt ut niſi mand •• averitis ca • nem meam facinus videtur jubere ergo figura eſt praecipiens paſſioni domini eſſe communicandum ſuaviter utiliter recondendum memora quia pro nobis caro ejus crucifixa vulneata ſit auguſtines determination ſet downe one famous sentence expounding thoſe word chriſt except eat fleſh sonne man c ioh 6 thus whenſoever wee find scripture ſpeech ſeeming forbid laudable good thing command haynous evill act ſpeech figurative vt cum aicitur niſi manducaveritis ſayd except eat fleſh ſeemeth command ſome hainous sinne therefore figurative commanding u communicate chriſts paſsion ſweetly profitably record memory fleſh crucifyed ſlaine u saint auguſtine one sentence hath beene alwayes held proteſtants convincent ſtrangling romiſh cauſe cardinall ſeeing gaſping haſteneth give ſome ſhort breath bellar lib 1 de euch cap 7 non vult auguſtinus dicere carnem chriſti tropice manducari ſi eſſentiam manducationis ſpectemus quae ſolum requirit ut verus cibus ab ore traijciatur ſtomachum per inſtrumenta vitalia ſed vult dicere tropice manducari quoad modum nam ordinanus proprius modus manducandi eſt ut caro viſibiliter ſecetur partes particulatim ſumatur cocta non creda caro autem chriſti ſumitur integra inviſibiliter et ſine ulla laeſione ſui qua manducatione figurate ſignificamus repreſentamus paſſionem chriſti 1 probatur quia non eſt ſcelus carnem chriſti ſpirituali modo ſine fuilaeſione ſumere 2 quia per ſcelus intellig •• modum edendi capernaiticum nempe tatnem lan • ando auguſtine ſaith hee meant ſay chriſts fleſh eaten tropically inreſpect eſſentiall eating wherein required onely true meat let downe mouth ſtomacke vitall inſtruments called tropicall eating reſpect ordinary proper maner eating viſible dividing chriſts fleſh part morſells ſod raw chriſts fleſh euchariſt received whole inviſibly without hurt maner eating wee repreſent paſsion chriſt thus proved becauſe firſt hainous ſinne eat chriſts fleſh spiritually without hurting secondly becauſe saint auiguſtine underſtandeth hainous offence capernaiticall maner eating thereof namely tearing piece hee wee muſt take whole anſwer piece confutation particular point leſt otherwiſe generall briefe anſwer might breed obſcurity cardinall thinketh evade multiplicity diſtinctions ob 1 hee meant eating teeth paſsing mouth stomacke sol falſe becauſe apoſtles receiving uſe chewing owne jeſuite suarez confeſſing sacramentall bread chriſts time wassee booke 1 cap 2 § 2 glutinoſus maner tearing teeth beene continued many age church rome alſo uſed 2 salmeron confeſſe ſaying proper eating requireth proper tearing even cardinall himſelfe calling eating dividing part proper maner eating ob 3 auguſtine ſpoke viſible eating chriſt inviſible sol blinde man could eat meat perfectly ſeeth ob 4 saint auguſtine underſtood chriſts fleſh sod raw sol though eating man fleſh raw sod could diſtinguiſh canniball ob 5 saint auguſtine ſpake eating becauſe capernaites interpreted chriſts word literall ſenſe eating perfectly ſo alſo conceive reall swallowing beene eaten doth cardinall plead wholly swallowing chriſts body hath alſo ieſuite coſter vnion chriſt body bodily mixture body communicant profeſſed ſome romaniſts day capernaiticall sect wee heare ieſuit reporting multi catholici temporibus odium haereſis veram praeſentiam corporis chriſt hoc sacramento—sumptione ejus fieri unionem inter corpus chriſti ſuſcipientem quam real • naturalem ſubſtant • dem atquè e • corporalem vocant sic algerus turrecremata roſſenſis hoſius late ſaith hee written againſt heretickes hee among others wee find cardinall card alan cùm comedimus euchariſtiam corpore chriſti vere veſcimur ex qua manducatione per naturae inſtrumenta real ••• onely excepted alſo cardinallfe • tur mendozam cardinalem burgenſem lib quem de unione ſcripſit docuiſſe chriſtum sacramentaliter mandu • atum non ſolum fieri praeſentem loco quem ſpecies poſſent suarez ieſ 3 tho diſp 64 § 3 recenſet viz irenaeum quandò mixtus calix fractus panis percipit verbum dei fit euchariſtia ex quibus augetur conſiſtit carnis noſtrae ſubſtantia lib 5 contra hereſ cap 2 ii chryſoſtom no ſecum unam maſſam reduxit nequè id fide ſolum ſed reipſa no ſuum corpus effecit hom 88 matth vt non ſolum per dilectionem ſed ipſa illam carnem convertamur hom 5 ioh iii cyril alex qui mandu • meam carnem manet ego illo sicut ſi quis iquefactae cerae aliam ceram inſuderit alteram cum altera commiſceat neceſſe eſt—ita qui carnem ecipit cum ipſo conjungitur ut chriſtus ipſo ipſe chriſto inveniatur lib 4 ioh cap 17 rurſus chriſtus vitis no palmites qui vitam inde nobis acquirimus audi paulum omnes unum chriſti corpus qui de uno pane participamus—quae cum ita fiat nonne corporaliter facit communicatione carmis ejus chriſtum nobis habitare lib 10 cap 13 iv greg nyſſen sicut parum fermenti aſſimulat totam maſſam aſperſione ita corpus chriſti cum fuerit intra noſtrum ad ſe tranſmutat transfert orat catech cap 37 v leo papa vt accipientes virtutem coeleſtis cibi carnem ipſius qui caro noſtra factus eſt tranſeamus epiſt 23 vi hilarius vere verbum carnem cibo dominico ſumimus quo modo non naturaliter manere nobis exiſtimandus eſt naturam carnis ſuae ad naturam aeternitatis ſub sacramento nobis communicandae carnis admiſeuit lib 8 de trinit hee might added iuſtin martyr others docet apoſtolus ex natura sacramentorum eſſe hanc fidelium unitatem ad galatas ſcribens quotquot baptizati eſtis chriſto chriſtum induiſtis—quod unum ſunt tantâ gentium conditionum sexuum diverſitate nunquid ex aſſenſu voluntatis ex sacramenti unitate quia baptiſma ſit unum ita que qui per candem rem ſunt unum natura unum ſunt • hilar de trinit lib 8 suſcipiens chriſtum non idem ſit poſt iavacrum qui ante baptiſmum fuit ſed corpus regenerati fiat caro crucifixi leo serm 14 de paſsione demini suarez wit irenaeus chryſoſtome cyril alexand greg nyſſen pope leo hilarie ſumme myſticam benedicens no ſecum inter no unum corpus fecit suarez 3 tho quaeſt 79 art 8 diſp 64 § 3 vnionem hanc pati •• dicunt non eſſe ſolum inter chriſtum no ſed etiam inter • metipſos quarenùs ſumus membra chriſti primiſius teſtimonie letter g immediately foure one chriſts body body communicant second chriſtian communicant chriſt body third naturall bodily vnion chriſtians among themſelves fourthly damaſcens chriſts body men ſoules kind preſences vnions mixture tranſubſtantiations taken proper ſenſe cannot condemne atheologicall ſenſeleſſe owne judgement notwithſtanding former alleged phraſes ancient father corporall conjunction ⚜ romiſh objection sentence ancient father vehemently unconſcionably inſiſted upon proper corporall mixture teſtimonies cyril alexand hilarie pictav sect ii wee therefore ſingled apart teſtimonies theſe two cyrillus 〈◊〉 10 cap 13 ioh filius per benedictionem myſticam ut homo unitur ſpiritualiter autem ut deus ſui ſpiritus gratia no ad novam vitam divinae naturae participationem redintegrans et lib 11 cap 26 fortaſſe etiam corporali unione cō jungimur licet diſparati ſums—nam ſi petrus paulus unum unitate chriſto ſunt petrus tamen paulus non eſt age igitur cum trinitas unum natura ſit conſideremus etiam quod no inter no corporaliter cum deo ſpiritualiter unum ſimus et lib 9 cap 47 chriſtus etiam no ſeipſo habet quoniam naturam noſtram aſſumpſit corpus noſtrum corpus unum ſactum eſt propterea divinae naturae participes facti ſumus filij etiam naturales—ita ego patre ſum quia ex ipſo natus ſic vos participes facti divinae naturae cum ſpiritum meum vobis habitate ſciverim chriſtus enim per ſpiritum nobis eſt corruptibilitatem noſtram ad incorruptibilitatem permutans et cap 39 opus eſt no participes naturae ſuae fieri novam vitam transformari quod liter quam per participationem ſpiritus fieri ne quit et c 38 nullus ambigit cum ad coelos aſconderit quin virtute ſpiritus ſemper adfuerit um praeſentia tamen carnis abfuerit et l 11 cap 3 cum poſt paſſionem coelum aſcenderit ſpiritum miſit non enim cum apoſtolis converſari poterat cum ad patrem aſcenderat dialog 2 trin si verè ſectionem partitionem divina natura receiperet intelligeretur ut corpus ſi autem hoc loco omnino magnitudine quantitate non eſſugiat circumſcriptionem lib 11 cap 26 illa verba ut ipſe vobis ſit ſicut ego patre conſiderandum eſt ſi ad unionem conſenſus et voluntatis naturalem etiam invenire poſſimus per quam no inter no et omnes cum deo conjungimar lib 12 cap 58 ioh chriſtus omnibus apparet viſibiliter et inviſibiliter inviſibiliter ut deus viſibiliter ut humo praebet etiam nobis carnem ſuam tangendam lib 4 cap 14 quommodò non vivemus cum carnem illam vivificatricem guſtamus manducamus et lib 11 cap 22 caro non prodeſt quicquam ſpiritus eſt qui vivificat ad ſanctificandum et vivificandum nihil prodeſſe carnem oſtendit quantum ſcil humanae naturae caro eſt cum igitur deitati ſalvatio tribuitur non debetis carnis praeſentiam propter hoc deſiderare idem cyril de trin qui myſticae benedictionis participes unum cum chriſto corpus ſunt unionem cum illo por fidem ſortiti et lib 4 cap 17 ioh sicut ſi quis liquefactae cerae aliam ceram infuderit alteram cum altera per totum permiſceat ita qui carnem ſanguinem domini recipiat cum eo ita conjungitur ut chriſtus ipſo ipſe chriſto inveniatur hilarius pſal 137 tollit etiam ſtultiſſi nam eorum temeritatem qui fruſtrato falſo que corpore domini carne viſum eſſe contendunt non recordantes poſt reſurrectionem corporis ſpiritum ſe videre credentibus palpate videre dicitur ſi corpus chriſti incircumſcriptum ſimul multis locis emitteretur lib 8 de trin panis qui de coelo deſcendit non niſi ab eo accipitur qui chriſti membrum eſt idem lib 8 de trin quomodo non naturalem intelligis unitatem qui per naturam unius fidei unum ſunt omnes enim renati ſunt ad innocentiam immortalitatem—ceſſat aſcenſus unitas qui unum ſint ejuſdem regeneratione naturae—docet enim apoſtolus ex natura sacramentorum eſſe hanc fidelium dei unitatem quotquot inquit baptizati eſtis chriſtum induiſtis—quod unum ſunt tanta gentium ſexuum diverſitate numquid ex aſſenſu voluntatis eſt aut ex sacramenti unitate quia baptiſma unum eſt unum chriſtum indati ſunt—itaquè qui per rem eandem unum ſunt natura etiam unum ſunt non tantum voluntate—cum dicit chriſtus ut ſin • illi unum ſicut ego tu pater unum ſumus—quaero ut rumne per naturae veritatem hodie chriſtus nobis ſit per concordiam voluntatis ſi enim vere verbum caro factum eſt no vere verbum carnem cibo dominico ſumimus quomodo non naturaliter manere nobis exiſtimandus eſt qui naturam carnis noſtrae inſeparabilem ſibi aſſumpſit—nos qui vere ſub myſterio carnem ſumimus per hoc unum erimus—de veritate carnis non eſt ambigendi locus nunc enim ex domini noſtri profeſſione fide noſtra vere earo eſt vere ſanguis et haec accepta et haec exhauſta nobis id efficiunt ut no chriſto chriſtus nobis ſit—eſt ergo nobis per carnem ſumus eo dum ſecum hoc quod no ſumus deo eſt quod autem eo per sacramentum communicatae carnis ſanguinis ſumus ipſe teſtatur dicens ego patre meo vos ego vobis non tantum voluntatis unitatem intelligit ſed ut ille patre per naturam divinitatis eſſet no autem eo per corporalem ejus nativitatem ille contra nobis per sacramentorum eſſe myſterium crederetur—ut no eo naturaliter eſſemus ipſo nobis permanente father choice ſpeciall becauſe diſputers whenſoever produce proofe romiſh doctrine corporal vnion eſteeme inſoluble others inſomuch one doctor hee objected sentence irenaeus greg nyſſen damaſcen leo saint auguſtine ſooner nameth sentence hilarie prefaceth ſaying notable place another concludeth doctrine cyril ſo abſolutely romiſh accounteth proteſtants better men ſold devill aſſenting common interpretation flaſh doctor appeare ignis fatuus blind zeale without knowledge wee come particular interim may know wee meane deale clearely wee firſt grant unto scope either theſe two father godhead manhood one perſon chriſt secondly wee grant father together generall councel epheſus call fleſh chriſt chriſtians participate sacrament vivificatricem vivificall giving life receiver even unto immortality thirdly wee grant name conjunction chriſt sacrament onely vnion affection concord alſo naturall corporall conjunction body chriſt bodie communicant laſtly wee grant one addeth similitude vnion waxemelted waxe yet notwithſtanding theſe acknowledgement grant wee preſume affirme theſe teſtimonies teach indeed myſticall romiſh miſſaticall vnion properly corporall touch chriſts owne naturall body body receiver ground ſame wee often layd former confutation wit paralleling vnion euchariſt ſeene margin vnions mentioned theſe ſame father aequivalent equipollent termes equally named naturall corporall albeit voyd corporall touch body chriſt ſelves grant inſtances uſed theſe father diver conſiſt onely relation ſome application alſo inſtance given relative onely reſpect incarnation chriſt hee tooke ſame nature fleſh upon relation chriſtian man fleſh humane fleſh chriſt univerſally perſons time even without sacrament called hilarie vnio corporalis nativitatis chriſti vnion wrought chriſt incarnation fleſh ſame specifically notwithſtanding called vnion naturall corporall onely vnion affection albeit voyd bodily touch next vnions made application ſome spiritually onely ſome sacramentall alſo spirituall vnion alſo free bodily touch ſay chriſt true chriſtians vnited vnity faith notwithſtanding likewiſe called corporall vnion onely affection come sacramentall vnion kind found sacrament ſome euchariſt ſelfe others indefinitely ſayd chriſtians united sacrament namely confeſſed regenerat baptiſme vnion corporall chriſt onely affection concord albeit alſo know exempted bodily touch accordingly vnions made euchariſt chriſtians among themſelves ſome chriſt u former vnion faithfull communicant member chriſt named naturall corporall vnion onely concord although know coincident corporall touch body reciprocally thus theſe holy father may underſtand foure ſeveral vnions one relative another spirituall third sacramentall generall fourth may ſay euchariſticall peculiar onely sacrament euchariſt equally named theſe father corporall naturall vnions vnions affection concordonely notwithſtanding one former three exclude bodily touch wee demand therefore theſe foure named naturall corporall improperly onely laſt ſhould inferre reall corporall touch chriſts body virtue ſame word naturall corporall cardinall giveth maine reaſon bellar lib 2 de euch cap 12 aliud eſſe apud hilarium aliqua eſſe unum naturaliter aliud autem unum eſſe alio naturaliter nam ut aliqua ſint unum naturaliter ſatis eſt ſi verè participent naturam ipſius rei qua ſunt unum hoc modo dicit ipſe omnes fideles eſſe unum naturaliter per fidem—ſed ut unum ſit alio naturaliter—neceſſe eſt ut natura unius merè ſit alio hoc modo—chriſtum eſſe nobis per carnem naturaliter quia natura carnis ejus nobis vere unitur per euchariſtiam ſame thing hilarie ſaith hee thing one naturally one another naturally thing one naturally ſufficient partake truly nature thing wherein one ſo hee calleth chriſtians one naturally faith one naturally another neceſſary nature one meerely within nature ſo meaning hilarie chriſts body ſayd naturally within euchariſt cardinalls ground aſſoilement whereupon hee relyeth rocke immoveable inſtantly prove wavering reed falſe fond may finde marginalls hilarie ſpeaking one vnions hee calleth naturall reaſon chriſts incarnation taking nature fleſh upon ſaith wee therefore cardinalls diſtinction falſe next sacramentall vnion whereof ſayd chriſt naturally u alſo expreſſely ſayd wee likewiſe naturally chriſt none affirme wee true propriety ſpeech naturally body chriſt therefore anſwer moſt abſurd aske ſtand ſcope ſame father confuting two former diver hereſies onely symbolicall myſticall conjunction body chriſt firſt thus eating drinking sacrament according chriſts inſtitution profeſſed vivificall fleſh chriſt giving eternall life unto world theſe father truly teach could fleſh meere man therefore nature god one god father ergò avant thou arianheretike second thus ſame humane fleſh chriſt would ſame divine vivifical power virtue except perfectly vnited godhead therefore chriſt god man relation two different perſons onely hypoſtaticall vnion two nature ergo thou neſtorian heretike recant meaning theſe holy father tranſparent enough owne sentence proved needed illuſtration might manifeſted like teſtimonies great cardinall mendoza reported taught namely father chriſts body ſo united body joyntly mingled part one another opinion improbable unworthy majeſty dignity sacrament inſtituted chriſt corporall spirituall conjunction conjunction falſe abſurd gabriell vaſquez take turne firſt make preface deliver opinion vaſquez 3 thom quaeſt 79 art 2 diſp 204 cap 2 tametſi antiqui eccleſiae patres exponendis myſterijs noſtrae fidei inſolita pa • um scholis uſitata ratione dicendi interdum utantur ita tamen eorum verba ſententias accipere debemus ut licet primo aſpectu aliquid abſurdi continere videantur nihil tamen contra ipſos niſi maturo conſilio examine aliorumque patrum aut conciliorum teſtimonijs nixi pronunciemus ibid cap 3 aliqui omnia patrum teſtimonia quae allegavimus per figuram hyperbolen interpretantur ut ita patres virtutem juju sacramenti eximiè commendare viderentur non quôd revera fieret ita ex haereticis hoc modo teſtimonia hilarij cyrilli interpretatus eſt calvinus—neque defuerunt complutenſes aliqui qui eodem modo per hyperbolen illa explicarent—ibid cap 4 quidam putarunt ſi ſine hyperbole explicarentur ſequi ut caro chriſti per omnem partem corporis noſtri diſſunderetur ut cera cerae lique facta—at non ſic diſſunditur—cyrillus uſus eſt hac ſimilitudine ad oſtendendam veram realem mixtionem corporis noſtri cum corpore chriſti non tamen quoad diſſuſionem eam ſimilitudimen locum habere putabat—nec enim eſt phyſics unio carnis noſtrae cum carne chriſti ſicut ex duabus ceris neque fieri unam carn • per converſionem unius alteram ſicut fit nutritione animalis naturali neque id ullus ſanae mentis ullo modo aſſereret although ancient father expounding theſe myſteries faith uſe word ſo uſuall schooles yet ought wee interpret ſpeeches ſo although firſt ſight containe ſome abſurdity yet take contrary meaning without due adviſe relying upon teſtimonies antiquity hee inſtances hee bringeth diver particularly similitude conjunction already objected cyr • l waxe waxe melted joyned together taken rigidity word hee denyeth note either diffuſion chriſts body part man body elſe subſtantiall converſion theſe acknowledgement ſo plaine primaſius concerning inſtitution sacrament ſaith primaſ 1 cor 11 salvator deus exemplum dedit ut quotieſcunquè hoc facimus mente habeamus quod chriſtus pro nobis mortuus eſt ideo nobis dicitur corpus chriſti ut cum hoc recordati fuerimus non ſimus ingrati gratiae ejus quemadmodum ſi quis moriens relinquat ei quem diligit aliquod pignus quod ille poſt mortem ejus quandocunque viderit nunquid poteſt lachrymas continere ſi perfectè dilexerit chriſt left u example often wee celebrate wee ſhould call remembrance chriſt dyed u therfore called body chriſt ſaith hee often wee remember wee ingrate unthankfull gratiouſneſſe like one dying leaveth pledge remembrance unto friend theſe holy father ſee interpret sacrament unto u preſent pledge friend abſent whether hee living travailer one departed life primaſius obſervation pledge remarkable hee ſaith sacrament thus called pledge therefore called body chriſt giving name thing token thereof similtude pregnant pertinent confuting tridentine faith concerning corporall preſence chriſt euchariſt seeing ancient father ſhewne themſelves patron favourers cauſe become u true child right purpoſe wee adde ſhew seeming contradictory saying father reconcilable themſelves yet repugnant romiſh profeſsion sect iii making good section required wee performe ſo doctrine father notwithſtanding reconciliation may appeare adverſe romiſh corporall conjunction alſo agreeable proteſtant ſenſe well reſpect sacramentall spirituall conjunction receiver sacrament hath body chriſt repugnancie father romiſh corporall conjunction sometimes father found diſpoſition body chriſtian philoſophy followeth diſpoſition soule soules faithfull departing life ſtate grace soules likewiſe vngodly paſſing hence thraldome sin ſhall reſume owne body virtue reſumption ſhall made poſſeſſors life bliſſe body soule wicked contrarily curſe damnation according generall doome come bleſſed unto one c goe curſed c learned suarez deny suarez 3 tho qu 79 diſp 64 § 2 gloria corporis reſpondet gloriae animae ſicut beatitudo animae reſpondet gratiae charitati ut ſicut hoc sacramentum ne que habet nequè haberé poteſt aliam efficaciam circa gloriam animae praeter eam quam habet circa gratiam charitatem ita que ne que aliter p •• eſt efficere gloriam corporis quam gloriam animae cō dudit hoc sacramentum non aliam conferre vitam immortalitatem corporis quam nutriendo conſervando charitatem gratiam glory body ſaith hee dependeth upon glory soule happineſſe soule dependeth upon grace therein neither doth sacrament otherwiſe conferre immortality body chriſtians heard heare inſoluble argument forſooth cardinall bellarmine extracteth thence bellar lib 2 de euch cap 4 inſolubi • e manet hoc dilemma aut poterat iuſtinus vere dicere carnem chriſti chriſtianis ſolum ſigno manducari aut non poterat ſi poterat p • aevaricator fuit cauſae chriſtianae nam odioſiſſimam reddidit fidem auxit criminum ſupicionem cum poſſet unto verbo fidem probabilem facere crimen diluere si non poterat certè id eo non poterat quia verè non ſigno tantum datur nobis comedenda chriſti caro dilemma ſaith hee remaineth inſoluble either could iuſtine truly ſayd fleſh chriſt eaten chriſtians onely signe hee could ſo ſayd hee could hee play praevaricator betraying chriſtian cauſe making chriſtian profeſsion moſt odious increaſing ſuſpicion one word hee might made probable ſo blotted infamy conceived againſt chriſtians hee could ſay chriſt eaten euchariſt onely signe doubtleſſe reaſon hee could muſt beene becauſe fleſh chriſt given eaten therein signe onely ſtomachum eſt trajectum et quod dicit 〈◊〉 illa gloſſa quod ſeceſſum non emittitur ſed per ſudorem aliter emanat fatuum eſt fingere qui per ſeceſſum taliter emitti poſſunt ſpecies ſicut emitteretur ſubſtantia panis vin non aliter illa autem quanquam non corrupta emituntur ut habentibus fluxum▪ergo ſpecies propter quod non eſt danda euchariſtia habenti talem fluxum quia ſe emittit integrum quod ſumit ſicut nec habenti vomitum 〈◊〉 iſtud magi cederet irreverentiam sacramenti quam illud igitur corpus sanguis chriſti tamdiu manet ventre ſtomacho vel vomitu quocunque alibi quamdiu ſpecies manet ſicut ſubſtantia converſa manſiſtet ſi ſpecies incorruptae evomuntur vel egrediuntur ut ibi verè corpus chriſt formes bread wine verily goe stomack ſo draught could subſtance either yet ſometimes paſſe uncorrupted body infirme eſpecially thoſe labour fluxe becauſe ſome ſo diſeaſed perſons let paſſe eat uncorrupt received whether vomit egeſtion seege hee againe doctrine ſo verily romiſh owne conſecrationem oblatio vocalis verbis memento dom • ne—alij dicunt eſſe de eſſentia sed dieo tam certum eſſe hanc oblationem non eſſe de eſſentia quam illam alteram oblationem ante conſecrationem—i quia chriſtus non adhibuit eam coena ii quia non conſtat eccleſiam eam ſemper adhibuiſſe nec eſt de inſtitutione chriſti ſed eccleſiae suarez ieſ quo ſup p 964 non eſt de eſſentia quòd dominus nec alphabet 〉 patrum libris fit mentio liturgiae matutinae veſpert • ae • actis concilij epheſ notat balſamon liturgiam conſtare ſola oratione ſine ulla sacramentorum adminiſtratione peculiariter interdum ad celebrationem euchariſtiae cujus partes duae ſunt recitatio scripturarum adminiſtratio coenae iuſtiniani novella 7 quod bellarminus ait quoties haec vox ad ſacra accommodarur abſolute ponitur pro miniſterio ſacrificij ſumitur inſignis eſt error nam exemplo quod ſubjungit luc 1 23 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 non eſt sacrificium ſed vox generalis omnia miniſteria sacerdotalia levitica complectitur zachariae autem ut lucas ait contigerat ſors ſuffitus offerendi non autem ſacrificandi—nec minus errat quod ſcilicet vix aliter hanc vocem à patribus accipi quàm pro miniſterio ſacrificij eſtates princedome prieſtdome thirdly king iuſtice becauſe ſome pope excited subject sonnes rebell againſt liege soveraigns parent fourthly originally without generation either father mother ſome beene borne lawfull wedlocke knowne honeſt parent albeit otherſome mother ſide hath beene much ſurer anſwer ſay popenon ſecundùm c • dinē aaron cujus sacerdotiū per propaginem ſui ſeminis miniſterio temporali fuit cum veteris teſtamenti lege ceſſavit ſed ſecundùm ordinem melchiſedech quo aeterni pontificis forma praeceſſit leo papa serm 2 anniverſ die aſſumpt ad pontif leo effect viz prieſts detracting sect vii doctrine cardinall name church bellar crucis sacrificium non eſt perpetuum ſed effectum ejus—nec dicitur aeternū quod non jugiter ſacrificatur—non caelis jam sacerdos per ſolam nullus ei succeſſurus officij ratione quià ſemper coelis interpellat pro nobis quod eſt sacerdotis officium nec caret hoc sacrificium ſua oblatione qulà ſeipſum hominem vulnerum ſigna quae paſſus eſt ieſuit scripture ancient father christ ſaith apoſtle prieſt ever according order melchiſedech ever cardinall bellarm lib 1 de miſſa cap 6 quod ſi sacerdotium chriſti durat uſque ad conſummationem mundi id enim scriptura aeternum vocat certè sacrificij ritus durate debet—at sacrificium crucis ſemel tantùm peractū eſt nec repeti poteſt ergò aliud eſſe debet quod jugiter offeratur et poſt aliquot paginas quod ad aeternum chriſti sacerdotium attinet neceſſe eſt ut ſaepius offerat vel per ſe vel per miniſtros vel per miniſtros non quidem cruentè ſed aliquo alio modo idem paulus docet cum dicit omnis pontifex ad offerendū hoſtias conſtituitur—nec dicitur aeternum sacerdotium quod non jugiter sacrificatur nec ſufficit aeternum quoad effectum reaſons alleged former section bellarmine reſtraineth time mortality end world chriſts priesthood extent concluding thereupon preſerving prieſthood chriſt hee either himſelfe ſome must neceſſarily offer ſome ſacrifice unto end world becauſe cannot bee done ever againe bee repeated namely bloody sacrifice upon croſſe hee concluding muſt therefore bee unbloudy sacrifice romiſh maſſe although argument deſerve confutation hath given enim manſurum sacerdotium ſine ullo sacrificio num 5—modus quo recentiores expliant aeternitatem sacrificij mihi nunquàm placuit atque non ſolium scriptura ſed etiam manifeſtâ ratione refelli poteſt praeſtat quantum quod mortale eſt immortale—praedicti patres exponunt 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 utroque modo commutabile ſucceſſione carens poſt cap 2 sacerdotium chriſti aeternum dici quia vnio naturae pontifex ad offerendum munera hoſtias quod quidem non videtur ad aliud referri poſſe quam ad miſſae sacrificium ut diximus ita adhuc coelis aliquid eſſe quod offerat reſp verùm graeci omnes patres cum locum ex latinis ambroſius anſelmus non de sacrificio incruento ſed de cruento quod cruce oblatum eſt intelligunt—quare ad ob reſp satis eſſe chriſto unum aſſignare sacrificium cruentum hoc ipſo quod eſt sacerdos quia ad hunc finem facta eſt vnio—neque opus eſt aliquid denuo offerre—quod autem offertur miſſa per miniſtros ſe offerat incruento modo non ideò eſt quod indigeat hac functione ut permaneat sacerdos ſed ut meritum univerſale sacrificij cruenti applicetur—num 35 diſp 86 ex patribus quos no contra haereticos ſupra adduximus nullus eſt qui aſſerat ex eo ſolum dici chriſtum eſt ſanguis teſtamenti quod mandavit ad vos deus de quo marc 14 hic eſt ſanguis novi teſtamenti—sic argumētamur sanguis teſtamenti veteris erat ſanguis victimae jam immolate et verè ſacrificatae exod 24 ergò ſanguis novi teſtamenti apud chriſtum eſt ſanguis victimae verè propriè ſacrificatae eſt autem ſanguis ille chriſti ut ipſe dicit hic eſt ſanguis meus ergo ipſe fuit victima coena immolata et ſacrificata blood old teſtament blood hoaſt truly ſacrifiſed therefore blood new teſtament mentioned euchariſt whereof figure muſt need blood chriſt properly ſacrifiſed therein hee heaping reaſon upon reaſon make mountaine preſently much working heaving cometh one owne family ieſuites vaſquez name kicketh downe heeles beene molehill ſaying vaſquez ieſ 3 tho diſp 190 num 15 novum teſtamentū ſanguine meo apud evangeliſtas paulum ſanguine chriſti prout eſt hoc ſacramento non convenit nam quā vi ſacramentum euchariſtiae ſit ſacramentum novi teſtamenti hac ratione dici poſſet novi teſtamenti—tamen longè alio ſenſu dicitur novi teſtamenti aut novum teſtamentum quòd ſit confirmatio conſummatio novi teſtamenti hoc eſt gratiae quam chriſtus promeruit generi humano de quo hebr 9 teſtamentum mortuis confirmatum eſt hoc eſt morte teſtatoris—undè ſequitur neque vetus teſtamentum ſine ſanguine dedicatur iude colligit novum ſanguine chriſti confirmari—et rurſus ubi teſtamentum ibi mors intercedat teſtatoris neceſſe eſt tandem ſic concludit caput apoſtolus ſic chriſtus ſemel oblatus eſt ad multorum exhaurienda peccata conſtat igitur ſanguinem teſtamenti dici eatenus quatenus eſt effuſus confirmatione illius ſicut hac ratione ſanguis hircorum vitulorum eſſuſus eſt exod 24 hic eſt ſanguis teſtamenti nam ſacrificium incruentum euchariſtia non erat cauſa univerſalis redemptionis—illud ergo effundetur remiſſionem peccatorum ſignificat futuram effuſionem paſſione called blood new teſtament chriſt sacrament referreth sacrifice chriſtes paſsion hee confirmeth moſt authenticall kinde proofe even scripture one chapter epiſtle hebrewes ſeverall place one theſe word teſtament confirmed men dead next heb 9 teſtament doth neceſſarily intervene death teſtator againe chriſt ſacrifiſed take away death many might added fourth verſ 15 chriſt mediator new teſtament death coming betweene redemption c one theſe pointing chriſts bloody sacrifice croſſe teacheth u deale law retortion thus old teſtament confirmed death bloodſhed creature ſacrifiſed ſo according apoſtles compariſon new teſtament confirmed death bloodſhed chriſt teſtator therefore could bloody sacrifice legalis feſtivitas dum mutatur impletur 〈◊〉 infra de ſacramenti inſtitutione loquens vetus teſtamentum conſummabat novum paſcha condebat cardinall object proofe sacrifice maſſe signe paſchall lambe sentence ſelfe ſufficient tell u faith church rome dayes direct point queſtion manifeſting cardinall hath egregiouſly abuſed teſtimony proofe vnbloody sacrifice chriſts body euchariſt leo ſpake ſo evidently expreſly sacrifice paſſion ieſuite vaſquez enforced toleo papa de paſſione domini serm 7 ſolemnitate paſch li exercendi furoris ſui iudaei acciperent poteſtatem opportebat enim ut manifeſto implerentur effectu quae diu fuerant figurato promiſſa myſterio ut ovem ſignificativam • vi vera removeret ut uno explere • ur sacrifi • ro varsarunt differentia victimarum nam omnia illa quae de immolatione agni divini • u per moyſen fuerant praeſtituta chriſtum prophetarunt chriſti occiſionem propriè nunciarunt vt ergo umbra cederent corpori ceſſarent imago ſub praeſentia veritatis antiqua obſervantia novo tollitur ſacramento hoſtia hoſtiam tranſit ſanguinem ſanguis excludit legalis feſtivitas dùm mutatur impletur teſte vaſquez ieſ 3 tho diſp 223 queſt 83 cap 6 againe solet ex leone probari miſſae ſacrificium unicum eſſe ex sermone 7 de paſchate opportebat c verùm ibi loquitur de ſacrificio cruento chriſti ſubdit enim omnia illa chriſti occiſionem pronuneiârant per occiſionem planè intelligit cruentum ſacrificum eadem ferè verba hab • chryſoſtomus pſalm 95 leſt word sacrament sentence leo may move conceive ſpoken euchariſt yet sacrament church rome bee obſerved nothing revolutione sacramentum et serm 16 de voce chriſti tranſeat calix iſte—quod non ſit exaudita magna eſt expoſitio sacramenti confeſſe thus much even hee ſought defend romiſh sacrifice euchariſt word leo generall thoſe thing performed concerning sacrificing lambe moyſes god command propheſied chriſt properly declare slaying chriſt hee ergo hee ſpake 〈◊〉 bloody sacrifice theſe prefiguration old law briefe reaſon bellar lib 1 de euch c 3 de figuris veteris teſtamenti sumitur hoc argumentum—figurae neceſſario inferiores eſſe debent rebus figuraris—sed veteris teſtamenti sacramenta panis melchiſedech panis propoſitionū—agnus paſchalis manna erant figurae euchariſtiae ſimplici pani aequales vel praeſtantiotes ergo euchariſtianon eſt ſimplex panis ſignificans corpus chriſti ſed et ipſum corpus chriſti majorem et minorē probam ex patribus figure neceſſarily inferiour unto thing prefigured old teſtament bread melchiſedech shewbread bread manna paſchall lambe figure euchariſt new teſtament therefore matter euchariſt ſimply bread body christ thus cardinall dr heskins alſo playeth deſcant upon baſe runneth voluntary large diſcourſe dr heskins parlam lib 3 chap 14 brazen serpent pole figure chriſt crucified ionas belly whale figure chriſts reſurrection paſchall lambe figure chriſt offered euchariſt thing better signe therefore chriſt herein offered better lambe sacramentaries ſay euchariſt signe paſchall lambe figure piece bread wherewith similitude thing prefigured excellent signes proved epiſtle hebrewes preferring new teſtament old whereby may conclude ſaith hee paſchall lambe signe sacrament bread body chriſt hee anſwer eaſie diſtinction thing prefigured figure principall called archetype ſome leſſe principall called onely antitype ſhall make matter plaine authenticall example 1 cor 10 2 wee baptized moſes cloud sea hence expoſitors aſwell aquinas upon ſame place aquinas teach sea thorow iraelites paſſed moſes signe baptiſme baptiſme wee buryed chriſts death rom 6 expoſition ſtandeth firme without contradiction whereby may perceive archetypon thing principally prefigured sea chriſts buriall water baptiſme antitype thing leſſe principally prefigured perpetuall end world saint paul intimate ſpeech euchariſt ſhew lord death untill coming againe 1 cor 11 ſee indeed betterneſſe betweene figure thing figured may ſay beene better diſputers forborne objection typicall scripture wee deſcend propheticall ⚜ chap iv objected propheticall scripture old teſtament diſputers violently wreſted proofe proper sacrifice maſſe firſt text malachy chap 5 verſ 1 firſt mal 5 1 objected cardinall maner riſing sunne going downe ſame name ſhall great among gentile every place ſhall sacrifice oblation offered name ſaith cardinall see teſtimony following notable teſtimony sacrifice maſſe state queſtion ſo good ſet downe state controverſie ſelvesinſigne teſtimonium pro sacrificio miſſae mal 5 1 verbis ab ortu ſolis uſque ad occaſum magnum eſt nomen meum gentibus omni loco ſacrificatur offertur nomini meo oblatio munda quià magnum eſt nomen meum gentibus dicit dominus lib 1 de miſſa cap 10 tota controverſia eſt malachias loquatur de sacrificio propriè dicto quale eſt eccleſia euchariſtia verò de sacrificio impropriè dicto quales ſint laudes orationes c bellarm ibid argum 1 propheta utitur voce minhhah quod eſt sacrificium abſolute abſque adjuncto ut cum dicitur sacrificium laudis c argum 2 vox munda opponitur immundis oblationibus iudaeorum quae non dicuntur immundae ex parte offerentium tantùm quià opponit illis oblationem non enim munda diceretur omni loco cum pluribus ſint mali miniſtri argum 3 dicitur non acciptiam munus manibus veſtris hinc colligimus non ſolùm mundam eſſe hanc noſtram ſed novam—argum 4 ex antitheſi contemptus hebraeorum erat publicis sacrificijs non privato cultu tantùm ergò gloria oblationum apud chriſtianos erit publico sacrificio argum 5 opponit malachias non omni populo ſed sacerdotibus tantùm veteris legis non omnes chriſtianos ſed certos homines qui sacerdotibus ſuccedunt ergò non loquitur de ſpirituali ſed de sacrificio proprie dicto whole controverſie whether scripture ſpake sacrifice properly ſo called vnproper sacrifice ſuch prayer thankſgiving c contend proper sacrifice wee denye wee grapple together wee ſhall firſt charge alleging corrupt tranſlation ground falſe interpretation romiſh objection grounded upon falſe text romiſh vulgar tranſlation even judgement ancient father sect romiſh vulgar tranſlation decreed councell trent onely authenticall thereupon injoyned uſe diſputations bound alſo thereunto oath bull pius quartus tranſgreſſe decree doth deliver u text every place ſacrificed offered name pure oblation c without mention word incenſe whereas cardinall bellarm hebraea graeca editione ſic legimus incenſum offertur nomini meo sacrificium mundum quo ſupra confeſſeth hebrew greeke text hath thus incenſe offered name pure offering c plainely ſaith septuaginta apertiùs valent lib 1 de miſſa cap 4 pag 526 valenta warranteth u call vulgar tranſlation falſe wee ſhall prove perceive without farre digreſſion wee meddle generall controverſie tranſlation inſiſt onely upon particular lion knowne claw ſo vulgar tranſlation may diſcerned one clauſe wherein word incenſe omitted quite yee permit u without prejudicated father trent try cauſe impartiall iudges ancient father primitive time eſpecially yourſelves ſo urgent preſſing u multitude teſtimonies defence romiſh sacrifice even expoſitions text malachy looke upon bellar vocem illam incenſum interpretatur tertull orationem ut ante eum iren lib 4 cont haereſ cap 33 incenſa autem iohannes vocat orationes sanctorū lib 1 de miſſa cap 10 § altero—hieron thymiama ie sanctorum orationes deo offerendas mal 1 chryſoſt bellarm lib 3 contr marcion ex pſalm 57 eccleſijs benedicite dominum deum ut pariter cōcurreret malachiae prophetia omni loco sacrificium mundum gloriae ſilicet relatio benedictio laus hymni word bellarmine reſtraineth prayer prayſes onely maſſe whereas tertullian ſpeaketh prayer generall againe lib 4 adverſ marc little beginning dicente malachia sacrificium mundū ſcilicet ſimplex oratio de conſcientia pura hee expoundeth pure sacrifice praier tertullian objected expounded ſame word sacrifice ſignifie benediction praiſes secondly euſeb demonſt lib 1 cap 6 omni loco incenſum sacrificium c quid aliud ſignificat quàm orationis incenſum sacrificium quod mundum dicitur eſt enim non per cruores ſed per pia actiones ſummo • offerendum euſebius objected calleth pure sacrifice pious action prayer cardinall could anſwer marvellous miſerable illuſion iii ob word bellar reſp non quaſi oratio ſit ipſum incenſum ſeu sacrificium ſed illud quod per orationem id eſt per verba conſecrationis perficitur solent enim patres verba conſecrationis orationes ſeu myſticas preces interpretati lib 1 de miſſa cap 10 firſt fondly word conſecration containe terme prayer ſecondly falſely father call theſe word prayer beene amply diſcuſſed sacrifice meant spirituall sacrifice c sol yet hieron objected malach 1 vt ſciant iudaei carnalibus victimis ſpitituales ſucceſſuras thymiama hoc eſt orationes sanctorum offerendas oblationem mundam ut eſt ceremonijs chriſtianorum bellar licet per incenſum intelligat orationem tamen per sacrificium intelligit euchariſtiam dicit enim offerri ceremonijs chriſtianorum ſo queſtion whether action euchariſt called ſpirituall confeſſed vnproper sacrifice hierome objected expreſly nameth sacrifice malachy spirituall come cardinal principall reaſon iv ob iewiſh sacrifice called vncleane reſpect offerer onely offering intimating thereby offering new teſtament leſſe body chriſt sol irenaeus objected plainely putteth difference made malachy betweene sacrifice offering wicked iewes sacrifice godly chriſtians hee giveth reaſon becauſe irenaeus ob adverſ haereſ lib 4 cap 34 ſpeaking well sacrifice iudaico populo eccleſia ſaith non sacrificia ſanctificant hominem ſed conſcientia pura ejus qui offert c eleemoſynae apoſtle calleth hoſtiam acceptabilem▪ opportet no oblationem deo facere ſententia pura eccleſia offert oblationem hanc fabricatori puram offerens ei cum gratiarum actione ex creatura ejus iudaei autem non offerunt quia manus eorum plenae ſanguine c iewes ſaith hee offered oblation wicked heart chriſtians performe pure conſciences iewiſh sacrifice rejected themſelves impiety sacrificer owne ieſuit ribera ieſ ad loca scripturae adducta reſpondere apoſtoli apud clementem lib 6 conſt apoſt c 22 hunc modum recuſabat deus populi sacrificia ſaepenumero eum peccantis que exiſtimantis sacrificijs • um non p • enitentiâ placatum • idem docet iraeneus lib 4 c 33 hoſ 6 num 24 ribera confirmeth conſtitutions pope clement alſo teſtimony irenaeus truth ſo evident divine collen preſume antididag colon tract de sacrif miſſae § de conſecratione quis ignorat vetera patrum sacrificia quae chriſtum ſigurabant vel ob id quod deus ea praecepiſſet per ſe munda fuiſſe nihilominus tamen frequentius immunda vocantur scripturis non ratione ſui ſed propter malam voluntatem offerentium none ignorant sacrifice old teſtament cleane pure becauſe god hath ordained became impure wicked heart offerer tertullian giveth ſame obſervation reaſon god rejecting ſaid tetull li 3 adverſ • cion sacrificia rejecta quià non ſecundùm dei religionem celebranda ſua jam non dei ſecerant pag 160 sacrifica ſpiritualia accepta nameth cor contribulatum laudem c lib adverſus iudaeos sacrifice sacrifice ſay father ſpake directly proper sacrifice new teſtament wee anſwer apply euchariſt meant proper sacrifice subject onely object therein croſſe reſpect chryſoſt objected pſal 95 ex hoſtia prima menſa myſtica coeleſte sacrificium ſumméque venerandum eſt autē nobis varia differentia lex multas habet hoſtias gratia nova unam—vis ſcire victimas quas eccleſia habet—quando fit sacrificium mundum immaculatum audi scripturam tibi palàm exponentem hanc differentiam et sacrificium quod antea dixi ſpirituale illud myſticum donum quo apoſtolus epheſ 5 chriſtus tradidit ſe ipſum pro nobis deo sacrificium chryſoſtome objected calleth sacrifice whereof saint paul writeth ſaying chriſt gave himſelfe sacrifice church epheſ 5 laſtly cyprian objected calleth cypr object ex • ib 1 cont iudaeos cap 16 novum sacrificium romiſh maſſe yet romiſhly reſt sect iv corne yourpſal 7 • juxta heb et erit pugillus frumenti ſummitatibus montium vulg lat et erit fitmamentū terra ſummis montium galatinus de arcani • cath veritatis li 10 cap 5 hoc eſt dicit chaldae tranſlatio rabbi ionathae et erit ſacrificium panis ſummis montium—cum ergo ait erit placenta frumenti terra capite montium vult dicere quod placenta panis duraeus ieſuit urged ſame galatinus moſt ſtrong argument behalfe ſaid doctrine ⚜ yea jeſuite suarez 3 thom diſp 74 § 2 adduci ſolent verba illa pſalmi 71 ut hebr erit placenta—qui pſalmus fine dubio de meſſia ſcriptus eſt suarez ſeemeth like cake hee alſo need licke ⚜ wee muſt tell galatinus credulous rabbinicall abſtracts better gibeonites old torne shooes mouldy bread ſeeming come farre even old rabbins invented brought latter rabbins glozers next bordering country becauſe author galatinus produceth foreſaid rabbiniſh prediction cake branded ſuch like conceipts marke vaine man judicious senenſis biblioth lib 2 § traditiones non poſſum ſatis mirari ſtudium petri galatini qui—in eam vanitatem devenit ut doceret opera thalmudica latinum ver • opo • •• public • scholis chriſtianorum explica • senenſis chaldee paraphraſe talketh sacrificed cake rejected corrupt puddle iewiſh fable fabulous point great romane dictator bellar pſal 71 ver 16 scio quod paulus burgenſis ex paraphraſi chaldaica adferat ad probandum hoc loco sacrificium miſſae ſed ſcio etiam quā multis fabulis iudaicis pharaphraſis illa ſcateat ideò piget ex lacunis expoſitionū iudaicarum haurire c bellarmine wee ſpeake offended heare rabbi calling hand prieſt head cake romiſh phraſe called wafercake indeed truly cake accident onely hath ſtill subſtance bread ſo farewell helena trent called tranſubſtantiation becauſe sacrifice better matter thereof permit followeth sacrifice properly body chriſt element bread thus author laborious kneading moulding greedy longing ſweetly chewing hereof length maner choaked owne cake challenge ⚜ way vindication truth allegation word maſter brerely againſt late ſlanderous romiſh traducer sect v bold romaniſt late ſeemeth well diſgeſting cake hath diſperſed received right honourable perſon lord c •• paper divulged maner lord durham ſaith former reaſon called maſter brerely moſt ſtrong argument moſt untruly ſaid appeare one reades proteſtants apology pag 156 hee flatly ſharply ſee charging mee palpable untruth tryall referring himſelfe booke ſelfe subſcribe ſaying sit liber iudex booke maſter brerely apology treatiſe 1 sect 4 subd 12 pag romiſh seducer himſelfe hath etiam sacrificia offerri ſaèpiùs oportebat crucifigi—eandem ipſam hoſtiam quā chriſtus immolabat offerimus 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 vel potiùs recordationem ipſius c chryſoſtome theophylact heb 10 pa 885 886 nunc ipſi ſine ſanguine immolamus ita quidē sed chriſti tunc reminiſcimur obitus una nobis eſt immolatio non multae quandoquidē ille ſemel immolatus eſt eundē ſempe • offerimus quin potiùs oblationis illius memoriam facimus perinde • ſi eſſet hoc tempore immolatus quocirca unum eſſe hoc noſtrū sacrificium conſtar—vnicum eſt ſemel oblatum—nam unus eſt ſanguis ſemel fuſus theophylact theod heb cap 8 cum eſſecit ut alia sacrificia non eſſent neceſſaria cur novi teſtamenti sacerdotes myſticam liturg •• ſeu sacrificium peragant ſed clarum eſt ijs qui ſunt rebus divinis cruditi no non aliud sacrificium offerre ſed unius illius ſalutaris memoriam peragere—dixit enim hoc facite memoriam mei theodoret ambroſ hebr • 0 oſterimus quidem ſed recordationem ſalutaris mortis ejus una haec hoſtia non multae ambroſe euſeb demonſt evangelic lib 1 cap 10 sacrificamus incendimus aliâs autem magni sacrificij illius memoriam 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 euſebius primaſius heb cap 10 quod deus c offerunt quidem • cerdotes noſt • ſed ad recordationem mortis ejus—ſicut ipſe dixit hoc facite commemorationem mei—vna hoſtia non multae—corpus unum cum illo quod ſuſcepit utero virginali non autem multa corpus nec nunc quidem aliud magnum aliud minus primaſius onely anſwer exception uſed note ſame body chriſt corporally preſent offered upon croſſe offered ſame maner effuſion blood indeed part whole truth ſurvey marginalls tell u sacrifice ſame body chriſt corporally preſent ſhould theophylact apply qualification maner whether bloody vnbloody perſon chriſt ſaying wee offer ſame chriſt violentum ac ſeſe oblationē ac victimam offert pro nobis sacerdos ſimul agnus dei qui tollit peccatum mundi quando hoc accidit cùm corpus ſuum ad comedendum ſanguinem bibendum praebuit cuilibet enim hoc perſpicuum eſt quòd ore veſci homo non poteſt niſi comeſtionem mactatio praeceſſerit qui igitur dedit diſcipulis ſuis corpus ſuum ad comedendum apertè demonſtrat jam perfectam agni immolationem cap 2 § haec non quae ſola actione conſiſtant ut pſalmodia genuflexio opus quodlibet ad honorem dei factum ibid § secundum non quae ſola oblatione ſita ut aurum argentum c ibid § secundo non non decimae aut primitiae § sed nec patres appellant sacrificium id quod ſolum eſt figura commemoiatio sacrificij § tertio non pia voluntas quia inviſibilis § secundò non eleemoſynae quia non ſoli deo oblatae § tertiò nulla reverentia externa ut genuflexiones precs quia actiones tranſeuntes § sextò paſſiones martyrum alia omnia bona opera largo modo—non autem propriè rigore sacrificia dici poſſunt sacrificia ſine ſerupùlo c pamelius exponit de miſſae sacrificio—at patiantur liberè dicere haec ad sacrificium miſſae non pertinere ſed de mielligi quae eccleſia ſive pauperum ſive sacerdotum alimenta cum enim vxores ſine conſenſu maritorum non poſſunt erogare ait maritatam chriſtiano ſine ſcrupulo liberalem eſſe poſſe quòd maribus illud concedat reliefe poore miniſtred woman wife autem invento novo sacrificio—quare non ſacrificatis—illud commune nobiſcum habent etiam templa altaria c reſp cyril multò poſt vitae honeſtas ad meliora propenſio eſt sacrificium fragrantiſſimum—et party remiſſion thirdly regard prieſts application remiſſion ſinne made church rome yet reſolved extent virtue sacrifice maſſe remiſsion ſinnes puniſhment sect never true application paſſion chriſt remiſſion ſinnes ſay wee abſolute onely partiall ieſuit ribera ieſ quoniam quotidiè peccamus quotidiè virtutem paſſionis chriſti participamus quod conc trid docuit quo cruentum illud ſemel cruce peragendum repraeſentaretur atque ſaluta • ejus virtu remiſſionem peccatorum • orum quae quotidrè à nobis committuntur applica • etur et h • c catholicis quidem hominibus manifeſtiſſimum eſt haeretici teſtimony heretikes deny manifeſt truth hee marke truth manifeſt truth truth ſaid confirmed laſt councel truth conſented unto heretikes manifeſt truth would looke truth univerſally profeſſed church inſtruction proſtrate himſelfe reverence bleſſed sacrament brute beaſt proſtrating ſelfe hoſt reverence unto wee would concealed ſeeme glory herein inſtruction like reproofe given miraculouſly balaam according maſters owne relation horſe taught art kneele perſon maſters command france suggeſtion inſtigation romiſh prieſts maſter called queſtion sorcerie hee vindication credit commanded horſe kneele crucifix therby freed himſelfe ſuſpition diabolicall familiarity according principle owne ſuperſtition one conclude bin god miraculous work horſe aſſe would ſeeme reaſon unreaſonable man becauſe miracle alwaies exceed power art nature elſe miracle thus fourth objection outward act paſſe example example invocation objected antiquity inferre divine honour sacrament pretended sect iv inſtances three principall gorgonia siſter gregory nazianzen whoſe oration funerall find greg nazian orat 11 de gorgonia soror gorgonia adversà corporis valetudine laborabat—eratque prodigioſum morbi genus quod nec medicorum arte nec parentum lachrymis nec publicis precibus ſanari potuit deſperatis omnibus alijs auxilijs intempeſtà nocte captatâ ad altare cum ſide procumbit eumque qui ſuper iſto honoratur ingenti clamore invocans cum caput ſuū part cum clamore altari admoviſſet deinde hoc pharmaco ie lachrymarum ut exponit elia cretenſis perfudiſſet ſi quid uſpiam 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 antityporū precioſi corporis sanguinis manu recondrderat ad lachrymis admiſcurſſet ô rem admirandam ſtatim ſe morbo liberatam ſentit troubled prodigious diſeaſe neither art phyſick teares parent aſwell greeke latine continued church rome unto day anſwereth thatreſpondeo sursùm corda non ſignificare elevationem ad locum corporalem ſed elevationem à rebus terrenis curis hujus vitae ad deum re aeternas non reſpondetur habemus ad firmamentum ſed habemus ad dominum et certè qui chriſtum quaerebant praeſepi templo ſepulchro sursùm corda habebant quia illum quaerebant qui eſt ſuper omnia deus benedictus ſecula—et fieri poteſt ut qui terram intuetur cor deor um—sic qui euchariſtia chriſtum quaerunt venerantur cor ſurſum habent ſi de ipſo chriſto non de negotiis hujus vitae interim cogitent duly conſecrated matter adored meere creature adoration muſt need leaſt materiall idolatry seven defect ſet downe romane miſſal rom pag 31 vbi debita materia deficit non conficitur sacramentum—si non ſit panis triticeus vel ſi alioqui corruptus et pag 32 si vinum ſit factum acetum vel penitùs putidum vel de uvis acerbis non maturis expreſſum vel admixtum aqua ut ſit corruptum non conficitur ſtinking imperfectly mixt liquor kinde conſecration void ſo neither body blood chriſt preſent ſeventhly yea water wine defect eaſily may happen beyond underſtanding every conſecrating prieſt let baker vintner judge sixe miſſal roman miſſ • e sex modis contingere poteſt formae variatio nun • rùm per additionem detractionem alicujus vocis mutationem vel ſi una pon • tur loco alterius corruptionem vocis alicujus detrahendo vel mutando ſyllabam aliquam tranſpoſitionē id eſt ordinis dictionum variatione ac deinde per interruptionem ut pronunciando unā partem formae ac quicſcendo per aliquod ſpacium vel loquendo aliquid impertinens minimum variatio deſtruit integritatem ſubſtantialem ſi pereat ſenſus bellarm lib 1 de sacrament gen cap 21 § secunda prop—sacramenta rata non ſunt ſi dum conferuntur unum tantùm verbum quod ad ſubſtantiam pertinet omittatur imò ſi unius ſyllabae omiſſio ſenſum verborum mutaverit aut corruperit collatum sacramentum non valet ut ſi sacerdos dixerit hoc eſt cor meum pro corpus meum azor ieſ inſtitut moral tom 1 lib 5 cap 28 § animadvert—hoc eſt c si quis diminueret aliquid aut immutaret de forma cōſecrationis vel aliquid addat quod ſignificationem mutaret non conſiceret sacramentum miſſal rom pag 33 haec ſunt neceſſaria neceſſitate sacramenti quibus ſublatis tollitur sacramentum ut nimirum non peccet sacerdos corrumpendo verba conſecrationis materially idolatrous sect iii example firſt bellarm si sacerdos fingit ſe conſecrare cum non conſecrat chriſtus abeſt—niſi intentio miniſtri fit • altem virtualis animo faciendi quod facit eccleſia non eſt conſecratio de sacram gen cap 27 si quis non intendit conficere niſi deluſoriè aliquid agere miſſal rom pag 33—vel ex oblivione cùm hoſtia aliqua lateat cùm non intendit conſecrare niſi quas videt vel ſi habens coram ſe vndecim hoſtias intendat conſecrare decem non determinans quas decem intendit non conſecrat quia requiritur intentio miſſal ibid prieſt conſecrating ſaith cardinall bonâ ſide sacramētum adorat adoratio enim potiſſimum ex intentione pendet quare ſicut qui panem non conſecratum injuriâ aſſiceret putans conſecratum eſſe graviſſimè peccâſſet chriſtum ſicetiam contra qui panem eundem adorat quòd certo credat non eſte panem ſed chriſtū propriè formaliter chriſtum adorat non panem lib 4 de euchar cap 30 vbi quis ſimpliciter adorans sacramentū non conſecratum eſt actus latriae actus moraliter bonus procedens ex motivo honeſto—sicut quando quis dat eleemoſynam homini petenti nomine chriſti ex miſericordia infuſa operatur ſi prudenter exiſtimaverit illum eſſe pauperem quamvis ſpeculativè decipi contingat suarez ieſ tom 3 qu 79 art 8 diſp 65 pag 829 col 1 omnis fidelis rectè adorans hoſtiam conſecratam adorat ſub eâ conditione ſi perfecta ſunt circa ipſam albeit tacitam azor ieſ reckoneth gabriel miſſae thom bonavent albert richard yea canoniſtas theologos excepting cajetan haſſel claud sainctes qui ſimpliciter ſine conditione adorandum monent azor inſtit tom 1 lib 9 cap 9 § decimo dicendum eſt quod per ſe loquendo ac ſecluſis ſpecialibus circumſtantijs per accidens occurrentibus abſolutè adorandum eſſe hoc sacramentum nullâ actu appoſitâ conditione ita ſentit thom 3 diſt 9 quaeſt 1 art 2 q 6 ad 2 ubi ſolùm dicit non requiri conditionem explicitam ſed ſatis eſſe ſi habitu retineatur habitu autem illam retineri nihil aliud eſſe videtur niſi mente animo habere intentionem adorandi verum chriſtum verumque sacramentum non adhibendi adorationem niſi cum hac pendenti exiſtimatione eadem ſententia eſt richardus ubi inquit licet fides credit chriſtum eſſe ſub ſpeciebus ſub conditione ſi omnia ſunt facta quae ad conſecrandum ſunt neceſſaria tamen ad adorandum non oportere ut fideles hanc conditionem adhibeant actuali cogitatione bonâ fide ſe cum propria uxore dormire putaret ita non eſt artolatra qui adorat chriſtum pane non conſecrato quem bonâ fide putat conſecratum c salmeron ieſ tom 9 tract 33 pag 181 although ſay margin yet object divine worſhip utterly condemnable even becauſe iealouſie almighty expreſſeth himſelfe iealous god exod 20 ſignifying asego ſum deus tuus fortis zelôtes exod 20 5 dicitur deus zelôtes id eſt zelum tenens zelus autem eſt amor privatus nolens habere conſortium amato et ſic viri dicuntur habere zelum de uxoribus ſuis quia volunt quòd uxores ſuae ſolos illos ament ſolis illis copulentur sic etiam deus volebat quòd idaei eam ſolum colerent eum ut deum cognoſcerent quando alius coleretur ut deus dolebat tanquam ſi vir videat uxorem ſuam amantem alium virum et ſicut cùm mulier alteri quàm viro ſuo copulatur fornicari dicitur ita qui alterum quàm verum deum colebat fornicari dicebatur scriptura cum dijs alienis abulenſ exod 20 pag 273 col 2 know hee indure conſort worſhip motto twenty hundred untill come thouſand ieſuite hath ſaid almoſt infinite defect indeed appeareth thouſand hazard every maſſe one prieſt two prieſts many ſo forward ſo one ſhould heare time maſſes ten one generation men chriſts time one offſpring hath beene chaſtly borne whereunto chriſtian dare ſworne challenge conſider wee beſeech god cauſe wee cauſe god whether god knowne tranſcendently iealous earneſt principle true logike • la intentio vittat opus ſed perperā inde colligitur opera mala ex intentione bona juſtificari nam opus bonum naſcitur ex integra causâ malum autem ex quovis defectu ownechap 7 8 confeſſions confirme ⚜ may ſeeme thing ſuperfluous apply former anſwer teſtimony ieſuite leſsius judging incredibile videtur deum tanti aeſtimare amorem quo eum amo quanti peccatum quo eum offendo quis enim eum qui principi facit injuriam vel ejus legem violavit ità ut mereatur mortem dicat ſatiſfacere ex aequo ſi illum amet doleat de ſuo facto promittat emendationem quis dicat ex natura rei tanti debere aeſtimare dolorem illum ex amore profectū quanti injuriam legis violationem nec jure poſſe principem injuriam retinere pro meritis punire hoc ipſo enim quod quis meritus eſt amittere vicam bona ſua omnia etiamſi millies amet millies doleat emendationem promittat cenſebitur ullo modo aequivalens offerre quod mereatur condonationem multò minùs poſſit homo compenſationem deo wherewith romiſh profeſſion adoration hoſt ſoconfeſſed chap 5 sect 6 ieſuit suarez almoſt infinitely intangled chap vii romiſh adoration notwithſtanding former pretence formally idolatrous proved foure ground romiſh profeſsion first definition idolatry sect divine honour ſaith ieſuite honor eſt teſtimonium excellentiae quod continetur verbo vel facto quae de excellentia alicujus convenientem exiſtimationem illi gignit sic honor divinus eſt quicquid verborum aut officiorum omninò accō modatum eſt ad gignendam exiſtimationem hujuſmodi quae divinam majeſtatem propriè conveniat hoc duplici modo ut opus ſit naturâ ſuâ ità praeclarum ut quis illud naturali lumine rationis ſolum deum talus honore dignum eſſe judicet quale eſt sacrificium alterum ut tale ſit intentione ejus qui vult de perſona quam honorat talem exiſtimationem excitare quae divinam majeſtatem conveniat licet honor iſte alioqui indifferens ſit gregor valent lib 2 de idol cap 3 valentia teſtimony excellencie whether word outward office man doth performe whereby hee doth intend beget others ſuch eſtimation god unto hee honoureth proper unto majeſtie god idolatry error underſtanding ſaith ieſuite eſt idololatria divini cultus erga falſum deum exhibitio colere enim pro deo eum qui non eſt deus aut ipſum laudando aut ei aliquo modo proſternendo idololattare eſt—idololatria quae eſt falſa adoratio non eſt niſi error intellectu quo dignum honore judicamus deum falſum cui idololatra ſe proſternit tolet ieſ inſtit sacerd lib 4 cap 24 § eſt igitur tolet yielding divine worſhip god whether praiſing invocating de adorat lib 2 diſp 8 c 11 pag 389 taught ſignes euchariſt adored ſame honour chriſt thereforepanis ſubſtantiam poſt conſecrationem abeſſe probatur quia ſi unà cum domini ſubſtantia panis ſub eiſdem accidentibus contineretur periculum eſſet nè populus ſimpliciter • doraret panem bellar lib 3 le euch cap 22 initio et alanus lib 1 de euch cap 34 non poſſe ait euchariſtia duplicem exiſtere ſubſtantiam quià eccleſia eſſet ſummo periculo idololatriae c ratio eſt quià cùm adoramus id quod deliteſcit ſub ſpeciebus panis ſi eſſet ibi adoraremus salmeron ieſ tom 9 tract 16 pag 109 contendit claudius sainctes ex unitate adorationis abſentiam ſubſtantiae panis colligere etenim ſi duplex maneret ſubſtantia sacramento una panis altera chriſti non poſſet citrà idololatriam unica adoratio utramque referri vaſquez ieſ quo ſupra bread adored sacrament chriſts body leſt people able diſtinguiſh body chriſt bread ſhould fall idolatry perſon communicating orally ſay body chriſt mouth adored regularly whysacramenta haec ſumente homine quià quamdiù eo sacramentaliter ſunt incertum eſt nec regulariter nec ordinariè ſolent adorari—praeceptor meus ioh benedictus magnum dominicani ordinis ornamentum docuit majus eſſe idololatriae periculum ſi chriſtus adoraretur homine quià homo eſt ſubjectum rationis capax honor eſt autem praemium virtutis ſign verò ſacra non propter ſe ſed propter re quas figurant exhibent ſunt veneranda ijs rantum periculi non ineſt quàm ſi homines peculiari hoc honore propter ſumptum ſacramentaliter ſic aliquandiù chriſtum eis habitantem proſequeremur sic enim homines paulatim deos eſſe putaremus eſpenc de euch lib 1 cap 6 fol 14 becauſe ſay man capable honour might fall little little hee ſhould honoured god owne ieſuites others yet wrong contemplation cum verbo aliquam diviſionis imaginationem meriti objiciat et tom 4 c 26—adoratione verò non ſeorſim deum nec ſeorſim hominem ſed unum chriſtum councel adore diſtinct nature whole chriſt challenge wee docet turr dicens hoc eſſet fidei fundamentum evertere pag 127 adduxi x • ſta qu •• ti ſententiam • n decreto canonizationis bonaventurae ubi confidens de spiritus sancti ſupremà directione conſidenter illum sanctum eſſe pronunciat ſidel • ter ab omnibus teneri praecipit—quod arroganter feciſſet ſi haec re ad fidem non attineret p 128 bonaveniuram protuli qui docet horribiliſſimum eſſe eccleſiam hujuſmodi errare poſſe periculoſum eſſe ſidei eò quòd ſi unus sanctus vocatur dubium etiam caeteri vocari poſſunt ità periculoſum eſſet invocare sanctos pag 129 adduxi iterùm teſtimonium hieronymi epiſt ad phil hom •• em non ſanctum sanctorum jungere ſocietati eſſet chriſtum violare cujus membra ſumus ibid ob sat erit univerſali credere canonizationem sanctorum veram eſſe canonizationem hujus aut illius credere non tenemur quià sanctus ſit pendet ex facto utrùm nimirum talis fuerit talia fecerit quo eccleſia eriare poteſt quià non eſt error fidei ſed facti pag 132 reſp numquid canonizatio sanctorum ſit genere non particulari de quolibet sancto pag 135 ob nihilominus piè credendum eſt eam errare non poſſe reſp ego crederem pietatem fidei eſſe divinae revelationis authoritatis non hominum pag 142 ob certa autem humanâ certitudine ſuadet credere pieta fidei certa verè divinâ certitudine jubet credere neceſſitas fidei pag 142 reſp credere vivum eſſe membrum chriſti quod eſt putridum fidem laedit quare eſt error pernicioſus pag 144 et thomas ſi per cultum exteriorem aliquod falſum ſignificetur eſt cultus pernicioſus pag 147 cultu divino abeſſe debet omne mendacium quià eo fidem noſtram proteſtamur cum deo agimus loquimur qui omne falſum fictum vanum abhominatur haec catharinus ibid pag 149 marginals ſhall find common opinion church directeth thinke church cannot erre function chriſtians bound believe ſame upon morall conjecturall perſwaſion onely upon divine infallible certitude becauſe ſay one saint may doubted might alſo canonization others called queſtion ſo would dangerous worſhip saint leſt wee ſhould worſhip dead rotten inſtead lively member chriſt error pernicious ſeeing every lye figment falſhood religious worſhip muſt need abominable unto god archbiſhop others aske maketh queſtion hand give▪ u leave tell challenge ſame archbiſhop catharinus catharin ibid quo ſupr • ob doctrina haec ſuadetur exemplis hoſtiae non conſecratae quam sacerdos exhibet adorandam ubi • ulla idololatria quià ſides eccleſiae non ad aut illas ſpecie • panis refertur ſed ad hoc quod corpus chriſti cont • etur ſub ſpeciebus panis quando fuerit rite benedictum putas tu quòd minùs poteſt errare eccleſia adoratione hoſtiae nō conſecratae quam cultu sancti p 132 133 reſp catharin petrus de palude aſſerit nullo modo eſſe dandam hoſtiam ſimplicem pro conſecrata quod eſſet idololatria quoniam cum miniſtratur etiam adoranda proponitur et hier ferrar cui quidam objectabat quod hoſtia per quam jurabat non erat conſecrata cui reſpondet ſi ita ſuiſſet feciſſet populum idololatrare atque ideò tanto magi provocaret ſeiram dei—audi hoſtia conſecrata • oratur chriſtus ut deus non ſimpliciter ſed ut exiſtens ſub ſpeciebus cùm igitur ibi non exiſtat chriſtus ſed creatura pro chriſto invenitur cui exhibetur latria atque ideò idololatria eſt idòlolatrae enim etiam hâc errant ratione qùi coelum puta aut aliquid aliud adorabunt putantes ſe ibi adorare deum quem animam mundi dicebant juxta varronis theologiam non igitur excuſantur ab idololatria quòd arbitrarentur ſe unum deum colere ſicut verè erat unus deus ſed quod illum ibi adorabant ubi non erat eo modo quo eſſe exiſtimabant ibid pag 134 135 deduceth neceſſity infallible aſſurance canonization every saint infallibility ought concerning conſecration euchariſt thus worſhipper may deceived adoring hoſt miſtaking bread body chriſt ſhould idolatry ſaith hee aſwell heathen adored heaven inſtead god hee marke aſwell idolatry heathen neither morall certainty good intent habituall condition could ever free formall idolatry argument owne confeſſions whoſoever may miſtaken adoring bread inſtead chriſts body may therein held formall idolater heathen biſhops propoſition aſſumption man among may manifoldly deceived taking bread chriſts body hath beene generall confeſſion concluſion muſt therefore adoring bread chriſt sacrament may formall idolater iv romiſh worſhip proved formall idolatry conſequence uſed conſecration pope sect iv salmeron ieſuite prime note church endeavoureth tofides divina eſt quâ credimus ieſum eâdem credimus hunc eſſe paulum quartum pontificem true pope onely morall humane aſſurance divine infallible faith iewes bound believe chriſt ieſus coming true meſsias ſaith hee faith cannot poſsibly deceived wee nothing ieſuits poſition place penderet ex externa intentione miniſtri commodum nobis eſſet repetere baptiſmum ea forma quam inſtituit alex 3 papa si baptizatus e ego non baptizo te c cumque non magi conſtet nobis de ſecundo hoc baptiſmo quam de priori eſſet tertiò quartò quintò baptiſmus repetendus salmeron ibid pag 188 et proinde liberum erit iſta conſecrata ſit hoſtia debito adorationis cultu adoretur ad ſalutem percipiant verè ſint miniſtri chriſti ibid pag 187 signanter dixi ſub fidem divinam pag 184 § vt ergò grounded aſſertion infallible faith due touching creation pope upon suppoſition concluſion upon like infallible beliefe men ought concerning conſecration euchariſt wherein ſaith hee ſhould vncertainty ſo faith ſhould depend upon intention prieſt like maner might every one doubt whether hee may adore sacrament truly conſecrated alſo make doubt prieſt himſelfe rightly ordained hee therefore theſe requireth faith infallible theſe forecited confeſſions owne divine firſt concerning definition idolatry adoration former pretence juſtifieth vileſt kind idolatry among heathen sect double kind worſhip one direct terminate pitcheth immediatly upon creature without relation creator whereof cardinall alan hath reſolved ſayingdicimus ad plenam reſolutionem cùm cultus terminatur ad ipſas creaturas idololatriam eſſe injuſtam alan de sacram gen cap 23 terminating fixing divine honour upon creature notorious idolatry ſecond kind relative honour relation chriſt whereof cardinall bellarmine hath determined ſayinglatria eſt cultus deo proprius nec per ſe deferendus imagini ratione relationis bellar lib 2 de imag ca 24 § tertio—hic cultus ſi exhibetur imagini propter ſe eſt vera idololatria ib § dicet—si idem cultus exhibetur imagini propter aliud ut aequè colatur creatura que deus certè eſt idololatria nam idololatria eſt non ſolùm cum adoratur idolū relicto deo ſed etiam cum adoratur ſimul cum deo ibid § praetereà—imagini non convenit cultus internus verus latriae nec externus proprius qualis eſt sacrificium ibid § quarta—qui colebant imaginem chriſti divinis honoribus inter haereticos numerantur ab epiphanio auguſtino damaſceno atque iſti cum chriſtum colerent ſine dubio imaginem ejus propter ipſum colebant non igitur imago licet divinis honoribus colere ie cultu latriae etiamſi quis dicat id eſſe facere propter deum vel chriſtum non propter imago ibid § sexta ratio haec bellarminus latria divine worſhip given image becauſe relation hath chriſt idolatry although given chriſt god whether internall elſe externall sacrifice hee wee ſay firſt put mind ofsunt benè multi qui imago colunt non ut ſigna—ſed magi eis ſidunt quàm chriſto polydor virgil invent lib 6 cap 13 many romiſh people adore image idolatrouſly although would cloake yet complaint outcry owne
