cujus author lutherus non requiri interiorem • tention • miniſtri ad perfectionem sacramenti non tàm inquit conferentis quàm ſuſcipientis fide ſita eſt virtu baptiſmi ſi miniſter joco abſolveret ſitamen credat ſe abſolutum veriſſimè eſt abſolutus et § johannes calvinus—vt ſi miniſter totam actionem intùs ſubſannans coenam chriſti ri • u legitimo adminiſt • et non dubitem panem vinum mihi eſſe veriſſima chriſti corporis ſanguinis pignora sic e ••• proteſtantes alij—catholicorum ſententia eſt quae eſt concil trid requiri intentionem faciendi quod facit eccleſia et pau • ò post § ad hanc—ad hanc haereticorum ſententiam acceſſit ambroſ catharinus quo excepto hac doctrina mi • ſi • è conveniunt catholici doctores cardinall allegeth authority addeth conſent doctor except catharinus produceth opinion luther calvin condemning romiſh doctrine condemneth cenſure hereticall wee permit diſcrete iudgements whether yeeld oſtentative • louriſh cardinall exact accurate diſcourſe salmeron ieſ intentio duplex publica obſervando formam publicam pronunciatione verborum c altera verò privata particularis ipſius miniſtri qui aut nihil credit eorum quae facit aut deriſoriè facit aut contrariam habet intentionem non cō ferendi sacramenta—at ejus intentio non eſt abſolutè neceſſaria rat quià cùm intentio intima ſit latens corde ejus inſenſibilis ſequeretur hominū animos torqueri ſcrupulis dubitationibus verum ſuſcipiant sacramentum quod ſanè scripturis et patribus contrarium eſt qui no firmâ fide sacramentum ſuſcipere adhortantur ii rat quia ſic hominum ſalus ex hominum aliquotū arbitrio penderet et ſic homines plus nocere poſſent quam chriſtus juvare iii quià plecterentur innocentes propter hominum malitiam quod remotum eſt à divina bonitate iv quià ſic liberum erit omnibus dubirare baptizati ſint et euchariſtiam adorent v quià hoc dogma proximum erit donatiſtarum haereſi contra quos diſputat auguſtinus docens per malos miniſtros conferri ſalutaria sacramenta vi mirum eſt olim eccleſiam controverſia novatianorum donatiſtarum aſſerentium baptiſmū ab haereticis collatum nullum eſſe de debita illa intetione miniſtri nihil diſputâſſe ergo ſatis eſt publica actio niſi miniſter contra proteſtetur aut aliquo modo vitiet formam sacramenti sufficit eatenus publicus actus ut notarius publicum conficiens inſtrumentum nec poteſt intentione ſua internâ licet deriſoriè agat illud validum reddere pro hac ſententia ſtant multi patres aug lib 1 cont literas petil oppugnans illud donatiſtarum conſcientia dantis abluit conſcientiam accipientis salmer ieſ epiſt pauli diſp 2 pag 186 jeſuite salmeron contrary grounded upon ſound reaſons among others perplexitie doubt whether prieſt hath due intention conſecrating worketh tormenting men conſciences injury god exceeding bounty goodneſſe contrary iudgement antiquity ſpeciall againſt saint auguſtine saepè mihi ignota eſt conſcientia aliena ſed ſemper certus ſum de divina miſericordia laſtly becauſe ordination function matter agreed upon ſides onely queſtion hee miniſtreth happen intruder conſecrated miniſter whether defect ſo nullifie conſecration euchariſt becometh altogether unprofitable devout communicant church caſe ſendeth inquire godfather godmother prieſt midwife baptizeth know whether hee beene rightly baptized ſatisfying ſhee ſeeke forth biſhop hee ordained ſo odainer biſhop ſo ſpeere untill come saint peter ſee whether theſe rightly conſecrated prieſt ſearch ſo many churchbookes know baptiſme one without act prieſt conſecrating fruſtrate adoration idolatrous contrariwiſe wee ſuch indeprehenſible caſe obſerve wee ſpeake extraordinary caſe wherein actor act hath apparent defect way ſcrupulous knowing thing worke ad modum recipientis heard example preaching word god iudas transformed devill yet ſeed god may fruitfull whatſoever seedman ground receiveth capable therefore might wee take occaſion compare ordination romiſh engliſh ſhew ſo farre conſenteth ſame wherein differeth farre juſtifiable lawfull upon ſo long travelling tranſgreſſe wandring bypathes laſt securitie romiſh perplexity habituall condition sect vii habituall virtuall condition conceived profeſſors ſtandeth thus adore hand prieſt chriſt chriſt otherwiſe • illing ſo chriſt maſters iffs ands divine worſhip theſe better church leakes ſhip threatning certaine periſhing ſtopped hitherto none beſt artificer ever able touching profane lecturer suarez ieſ simpliciter adorandus eſt chriſtus euchariſtia aliud exigere ex ii eſſet ſuperſtitioſum vanis ſcrupulis ſuperſtitionibus expoſitū neque enim eſt conſentaneum ibi trepidare ubi non eſt vel probabilis ratio timendi ſed potiùs periculum nè dubitatione devotio animi minuatur tom 3 qu 79 art 8 diſp 65 sect 2 suarez labouring perſwade adore chriſt euchariſt ſimply without ſcrupulizing ſaying fit feare feare hee himſelfe heard hath told u poſſibly incidentsee chap 5 sect 6 almoſt infinite defect conſequently many cauſes doubting may diſannull ⚜whole act conſecration ⚜ every morall certaintie leſsius ieſ opuſc tract de praeſcien condit cap 21 § sed contra—moralis certitudo non eſt abſoluta ſed ſecundùm quid qualis nimiùm per conjecturas poſſit haberi ex ſignis cum quibus non neceſſariò conjungitur veritas rei ſignatae ieſuit confeſſe conjecturall ⚜ therefore needeth none confutation owne ſhameleſſe contradiction may ſee palpably groſſe impoſſible allay deteſtable ſtench plaine idolatry certainely auguſtine heard worſhip latria hee everywhere teacheth proper god performed bread wine matter divine adoration hee neither better lurking hole ſo ſeemeth two ieſuits azorius quo ſupra mihi verò verior videtur eorum eſſe ſententia qui opinantur vulgatā editionem non ſolum rebus fidei morū ſed caeteris quo que omnibus omni errore carere quia licet aliquando aliqua ſignificantius proprius ac latius reddi potuerit non tamen verius aut ſimpliciter certius azorius greg valent analyſ lib 8 c 4 § etenim c quod autem eccleſia addit ne ullus illā quovis praetextu audeat rejicere id profecto evidenti argumento eſt omnibus omninò locis quod attinet ad omnes ſcripturae ſententias eſſe hanc ut authenticam e conformem scripturae originali à concilio approbatam secus enim praetextus aliquis ſupereſſet quò non obſtante hac definitione concilii poſſet aliquandò ea editio diſputationibus rejici nempè ſi diceretur hoc certè aut illo loco non eſſe hujus authorem editionis spiritus sancti mentem aſſequutum—in omnibus igitur locis vult concilium eam haberi pro authenticâ exceptis erroribus typographorum—vt iudic cap 11 pro altera matre lectum fuiſſe adultera matre ut quidam objiciunt—nam concilium probavit veterem benè typis impreſſam—poſt § porrò nullo modo audiendi ſunt ii qui poſt concilium tridentinum contendunt editionem vulgatam aliquibus locis quod ad ipſam ſententiam attinet emendari quin potiùs graeci hebraici codex ſiquidem diſſideant à noſtra ſunt per eam corrigendi valentia thinke oath thusepheſ 1 14 lat vulg spiritu ſignati promiſſionis quae eſt pignus haereditatis graecè 〈 nonlatin alphabet 〉 quem locum hieronym pignus latinus interpres pro arrhabone poſuit arrhabo futurae emptionis quaſi quoddam teſtimonium obligamentum datur pignus verò pro mutuâ pecuniâ ponitur cùm illa reddita fuerit reddenti debitum pignus à creditore aug serm de viſione dei tom 10 pag 1687 accipis codicem ab amico cui da pignus cum reddideris quod accopiſti illc cui reddis habebit tu pignus accipies non enim habebit ambas re ſed quando pretium para dare pro ea quam tenes bonae fidei contractu de ipſo pretio da aliquid exit arrha non pignus quod ſit complendum non quod ſit auferendum sed ſi deus charitatem dat tanquam pignus per ſpiritum ſuum cum eam rem ipſam reddiderit quâ promiſſa pignus dedit auferendum eſt à nobis pignus abſit sed quod dedit hoc implebit ideo melius arrha quàm pignus—hoc enim implebitur cum arrha data eſt ſealed ſpirit promiſe pledge inheritance greeke ſealed ſpirit tamen ad fidem ſpectat item diſp 51 qua multitudine patrum locum ab autoritate infirmum —pauperis eſt numerare pecus—exod 13 judicio plurimorum non acquitſces ſententiae ut à vero demas multitudinem
